infricolo: <entryFree id="n23302" type="main" key="infri^co^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrĭcŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>infrico</etym>, <sense id="n23302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <pb n="949" /> <cb n="INFR" /> <hi rend="ital">rub in repeatedly</hi> (late Lat.): oculum infricolato, Pelag. Veter. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infrictio: <entryFree id="n23303" type="main" key="infricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infrico</etym>, <sense id="n23303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infrictionem ei membro adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. frictionem).</sense></entryFree>
infrictus: <entryFree id="n23304" type="main" key="infrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrictus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infrico.</entryFree>
infrigesco: <entryFree id="n23305" type="main" key="infri_gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frīgesco</orth>, <itype>frixi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become cold</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum infrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrigidatio: <entryFree id="n23306" type="main" key="infri_gi^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrīgĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infrigido</etym>, <sense id="n23306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrigido: <entryFree id="n23307" type="main" key="infri_gi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frīgĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make cold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cool</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: infrigidatus fuit, Vet. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infringo: <entryFree id="n23308" type="main" key="infringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>infrango</etym>, <sense id="n23308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crack.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23308.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infractis omnibus hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis violas riguove papavera in horto Liliaque infringat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genibusque tumens infringitur unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:412" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 412</bibl></cit>: manus, <hi rend="ital">to snap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crack one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fingers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: latus liminibus, <hi rend="ital">to bruise one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s side by lying on the threshold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:22" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 22</bibl>: infractus remus, <hi rend="ital">appearing broken</hi>, in consequence of the refraction of the rays in the water, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infracti radii resiliunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 38, 38, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa infracta extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23308.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> one thing <hi rend="ital">against</hi> another: digitos citharae, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">play upon the lute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:575" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 575</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui colaphum,</quote> <trans><tr>to give one a box on the ear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam (metu),</quote> <trans><tr>to stammer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 155</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23308.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primus incursus et vis militum infringeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatus adversariorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunatum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius esse quiddam suspicor, quod te infringat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuam laudem humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Samnitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to overcome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 9, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortia facta suis modis,</quote> <trans><tr>to weaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:412" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos precatu,</quote> <trans><tr>to appease by entreaties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:144" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infringitur ille quasi verborum ambitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infringendis concidendisque numeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem de industria,</quote> <trans><tr>purposely to make plaintive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23308.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make void</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam haec gloriatio non infringetur in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 66</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">infractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23308.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mares caprarum longis auribus infractisque probant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 202</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23308.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhausted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subdued.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23308.7" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">infractos animos gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil infractus Appii animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 59, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio submissa et infracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infractae ad proelia vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritas,</quote> <trans><tr>falsified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides metu infracta,</quote> <trans><tr>shaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <trans><tr>diminished</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>injured reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latini,</quote> <trans><tr>broken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23308.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Diluted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel aqua infractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 186</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23308.9" n="c" level="4"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">broken off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infracta et amputata loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>broken</tr>, <tr>unconnected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infracta loquela,</quote> <trans><tr>broken talk</tr>, <tr>baby - talk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vocem ejus (delicati) infractam videret,</quote> <trans><tr>effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocibus delinitus infractis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrio: <entryFree id="n23309" type="main" key="infri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crumble into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strew upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinam in aquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaver,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 12</bibl>: seni papaverem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruta infriata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infrons: <entryFree id="n23310" type="hapax" key="infrons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frons</orth>, <itype>ondis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without foliage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treeless</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infrontate: <entryFree id="n23311" type="hapax" key="infronta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-frontātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impudently</hi>, Fulg. de Prisc. Serm. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 22.</sense></entryFree>
infructiferus: <entryFree id="n23312" type="main" key="infructi^fe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infructĭfĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing no fruit</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Ps. - <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fr. Erem. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fr. Erem. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infructuose: <entryFree id="n23313" type="main" key="infructu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infructŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. infructuosus <sense id="n23313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
infructuositas: <entryFree id="n23314" type="main" key="infructu^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infructŭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infructuosus</etym>, <sense id="n23314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unproductiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Judaica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Resurr. Carn. 33</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INFU" /></sense></entryFree>
infructuosus: <entryFree id="n23315" type="main" key="infructu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fructŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23315.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23315.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruitless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infructŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fruitlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 12</bibl>, n. 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 67</bibl>, n. 6.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infrunitus: <entryFree id="n23316" type="main" key="infru_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infrūnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-fruniscor</etym>, <sense id="n23316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfit for enjoyment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:31:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 31, 23</bibl>, and 23, 6.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">infrūnītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">senselessly</hi> (late Lat.), Hilar. in Job, 3, p. 220.</sense></entryFree>
infucatus: <entryFree id="n23317" type="main" key="infu_ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fūcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. in</etym>, <sense id="n23317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infucata vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23318" type="main" key="infu_ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fūcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n23318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not painted</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infudibulum: <entryFree id="n23319" type="main" key="infu_di^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūdĭbŭlum</orth>, v. infundibulum.</entryFree>
infula: <entryFree id="n23320" type="main" key="infu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. bhāla, brow; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa/los, fa/lara</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n23320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bandage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23320.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in infulis tantam rem depingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23320.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a white and red fillet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">band of woollen stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn upon the forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a sign of religious consecration and of inviolability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sacred fillet;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">a priest</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fillet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes Cereris cum infulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi Triviaeque sacerdos, Infula cui sacrā redimibat tempora vittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 538</bibl></cit>: cujus sacerdotii (i. e. fratrum arvalium) insigne est spicea corona et infulae albae, Sabin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">a priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 486</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">victim</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fillet</hi> (whether beast or man): <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in honore deum medio stans hostia ad aram, Lanea dum niveā circumdatur infula vittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infula virgineos circumdata comptus (of Iphigenia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 87</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the fillet worn by a suppliant for protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velata infulis ramisque oleae Carthaginiensium navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velamenta et infulas praeferentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae litterae (philosophy) apud mediocriter malos infularum loco sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>held in awe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsas miserias infularum loco habet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his wretchedness claims reverence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Helv. 13, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23320.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark of distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badge of honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his insignibus atque infulis imperii venditis (said of the lands belonging to the state),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">The insignia of an office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 63, 1</bibl></cit>: infulae imperiales, id. tit. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> — Hence, for <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> itself, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Ornaments of houses and temples</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">carved work</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 355</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infulatus: <entryFree id="n23321" type="main" key="infu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>infula</etym>, <sense id="n23321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with the</hi> infula; <cit><quote lang="la">so of victims or of human beings who were led to death adorned like victims,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 642</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mystae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex infulatus,</quote> <trans><tr>king David adorned with the diadem</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 5</bibl></cit>: domus, id. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ stef.</foreign> 4, 79.</sense></entryFree>
infulcio: <entryFree id="n23322" type="main" key="infulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fulcĭo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cram in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23322.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 53</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23322.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foist in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum omnibus locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infulsit praeterea nomen Severi,</quote> <trans><tr>he added to his own names</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macrin. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infulgerat: <entryFree id="n23323" type="gloss" key="infulge^rat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infulgĕrat</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n23323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it lightens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infullonicatus: <entryFree id="n23324" type="gloss" key="infullo_ni^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infullōnĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. infullo</etym>, <sense id="n23324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not fulled</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/knafos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
infumibulum: <entryFree id="n23325" type="main" key="infu_mi^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūmĭbŭlum</orth>, v. infurnibulum.</entryFree>
infumo: <entryFree id="n23326" type="main" key="infu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fūmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry in the smoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini cerebrum infumatum,</quote> <trans><tr>smoked</tr>, <tr>smoke-dried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 63, § 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:176" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 48, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infumus: <entryFree id="n23327" type="main" key="infu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, i. q. infimus.</entryFree>
infundibulum: <entryFree id="n23328" type="main" key="infundi^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infundĭbŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">infūd-, infīd-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>infundo</etym>, <sense id="n23328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funnel</hi> (cf. infurnibulum). </sense><sense id="n23328.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 10, 12</bibl> and 13 (infidibula). — </sense><sense id="n23328.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the funnel</hi> in a mill, through which the grain is poured, <hi rend="ital">the hopper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infundo: <entryFree id="n23329" type="main" key="infundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> (syn. invergere). </sense><sense id="n23329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aliquod vas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum reticulo aut cribro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 69, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine riguis mare in salinas infundentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 81</bibl></cit>: rex Mithridates Aquilio duci <cb n="INFU" /> capto aurum in os infudit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 14, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas formatae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 5</bibl>: sibi resinam et nardum, <hi rend="ital">to anoint one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self with</hi>, Auct. B. H. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23329.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23329.3" n="1" level="3"> Infundere alicui aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to pour out for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to administer to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:77" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentis hordea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Neroni) totam tremuli frontem pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:616" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 616</bibl></cit>.—Esp., as a medicine, <hi rend="ital">to administer to</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">for</hi> a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">(aloë) dysenteriae infunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenesmo et dysentericis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 227</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">clystere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 66</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23329.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivam aceto non acerrimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si uvam nimius imber infuderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23329.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbum desuper alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas margaritasque mare littoribus infundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim sagittarum ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina infusa Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. 7, 9, 8.—</sense><sense id="n23329.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mix itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homines humiliores in alienum ejusdem nominis infunderentur genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23329.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pour into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem in aures tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ejusmodi auribus ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris auribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magorum sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aures cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:433" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia in civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ex illius animo quod semel esset infusum, umquam effluere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 154" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati detrimenta (acc. to others, infligere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">poured over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23329.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus infusus auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 27, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis in aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus per nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 92, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <trans><tr>drunk with wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusam vomitu egerere aquam,</quote> <trans><tr>swallowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23329.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things not fluid: <cit><quote lang="la">nudos umeris infusa capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>falling down on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem infuso pulvere foedans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua concurrerat, obruebatur (navis) infuso igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole infuso (terris),</quote> <trans><tr>at daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugis gremio,</quote> <trans><tr>resting on her bosom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collo infusa amantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus circo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totamque infusa per artus Mens agitat molem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusa tranquilla per aethera pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:258" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera in eam formam gypsi infusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 4, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago senis cadaveri infusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infurnibulum: <entryFree id="n23330" type="main" key="infurni^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infurnĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in - furnus</etym>, <sense id="n23330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funnel for inhaling smoke</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is nidor per infurnibulum imbibitur in tussi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl></cit> (Jahn and others read infundibulum; Gloss. Philox. infumibulum <foreign lang="greek">kapnodo/xh</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
infusco: <entryFree id="n23331" type="main" key="infusco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fusco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23331.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">humida fulmina non urunt sed infuscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā infuscatā atramento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 45, § 84</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vict. Orig. Gentis R. 14: vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam sanie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rufum colorem nigro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to dilute wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saporem,</quote> <trans><tr>to spoil the taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: sonum, <hi rend="ital">to obscure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lower the voice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl>: vox non infuscata, Sen. praef. Contr. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n23331.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarnish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuo ne quid infuscaverit,</quote> <trans><tr>lest he do some mischief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eos aliqua barbaries domestica infuscaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitas non infuscata malevolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosam militiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae gloriam saevitiae macula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus pietatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Declam. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
infuscus: <entryFree id="n23332" type="main" key="infuscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-fuscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes infusci coloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10:1" default="NO">9, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infusio: <entryFree id="n23333" type="main" key="infu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>infundo</etym>, <sense id="n23333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wetting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infusione emollit oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>a clyster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 228</bibl></cit>; v. infundo; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 113, § 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theriacae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. Dav. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velleris,</quote> <trans><tr>a coloring</tr>, <tr>dyeing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umoris,</quote> <trans><tr>a flowing</tr>, <tr>flow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:99" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:154" default="NO">154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infusor: <entryFree id="n23334" type="main" key="infu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pours in;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="950" /> <cb n="INGE" /></sense></entryFree>
infusorium: <entryFree id="n23335" type="main" key="infu_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>infundo</etym>, <sense id="n23335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a can</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reservoir for a lamp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
infusus: <entryFree id="n23336" type="main" key="infu_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from infundo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23337" type="main" key="infu_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">infūsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>infundo</etym>, <sense id="n23337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an injection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus auris emendat infusu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 15, § 24</bibl></cit> (only in <case>abl.</case>).</sense></entryFree>
ingaevoncs: <entryFree id="n23338" type="main" key="Ingaevo^ncs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ingaevŏncs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the ocean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl> (al. Ingyaeones).</sense></entryFree>
ingauni: <entryFree id="n23339" type="main" key="Ingauni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ingauni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liguria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the sea - coast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of the Maritime Alps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Album Ingaunum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">their capital city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>; called also: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Albingaunum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 15</bibl>; its inhabitants are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Albingauni Lĭ-gŭres</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingemino: <entryFree id="n23340" type="main" key="inge^mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n23340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to redouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reiterate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23340.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā ingeminans ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidas voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox assensu nemorum ingeminata remugit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miserum! ingeminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 653</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:328" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 328</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23340.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be redoubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeminant austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeminant plausu Tyrii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 747</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeminant curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 531</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingemisco: <entryFree id="n23341" type="main" key="inge^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕmisco</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype>, 3. <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n23341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to groan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sigh over</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n23341.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23341.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ingemiscis hostem Dolabellam judicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemuit citro non satis esse suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:59:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 59, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23341.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 235</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕmiscendus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">lamentable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23341.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri Spartani non ingemiscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ingemiscant patres nostri, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tu ingemiscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Att. 7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulli malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit> (a transl. from Sophocles): <cit><quote lang="la">ingemiscamus illis, quae patiebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luce) repertā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23341.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis ingemiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1732" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1732</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingemitus: <entryFree id="n23342" type="gloss" key="inge^mi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕmĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a groan</hi>: ingemitus, <foreign lang="greek">e)pistenagmo/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ingemmesco: <entryFree id="n23343" type="main" key="ingemmesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gemmesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n23343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become a jewel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 14, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingemo: <entryFree id="n23344" type="main" key="inge^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n23344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to groan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sigh over</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to mourn over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewail.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23344.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus interitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesos ingemunt nati patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1758" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemuit citro non satis esse suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23344.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mourn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsiliis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemens laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditioni suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 28, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23344.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemuit solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne nemus ingemuit alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:577" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 577</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingenerasco: <entryFree id="n23345" type="main" key="inge^ne^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĕrasco</orth>, v. generasco.</entryFree>
ingenero: <entryFree id="n23346" type="main" key="inge^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n23346.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To implant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23346.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ingenerat amorem in eos qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: homini soli cupiditas ingeneratur, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingenerantur hominibus mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenerata familiae frugalitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec astro ingenerata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23346.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to generate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum esse ingeneratum a Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas quam ingeneravit natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23346.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to plant.</hi>— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ingenera; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sunt genitalia tempora mundi (sc. tellurem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:196" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingeniatus: <entryFree id="n23347" type="main" key="inge^ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭāt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingenium</etym>, <sense id="n23347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">naturally constituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apt by nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide ingeniatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: ad astutiam, App. Flor. n. 18, p. 360, 20.</sense></entryFree>
ingeniculatus: <entryFree id="n23348" type="main" key="inge^ni^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. ingeniculo <sense id="n23348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ingeniculo: <entryFree id="n23349" type="main" key="inge^ni^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-geniculum</etym>, <sense id="n23349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause one to bend the knee;</hi> hence, ingeniculare se, <hi rend="ital">to bend the knee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sink down on the knee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kneel</hi>, Hyg. Astr. <cb n="INGE" /> 2, 6, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">without se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">kneeling</hi>: Hercules, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, also called ingeniculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingeniculus: <entryFree id="n23350" type="main" key="inge^ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-geniculum</etym>, <sense id="n23350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kneeling</hi>: Ingeniculus, sc. Hercules, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>: in extremis partibus oritur Ingeniculus, qui a Graeeis <foreign lang="greek">e)n go/nasin</foreign> dicitur, Firm. Math. 8, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenicla (by sync. for ingenicula) imago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 645</bibl></cit>; v. ‡ engonasi.</sense></entryFree>
ingeniolum: <entryFree id="n23351" type="main" key="inge^ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ingenium</etym>, <sense id="n23351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little genius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble intellect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Ruf. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ingeniose: <entryFree id="n23352" type="main" key="inge^ni^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ingeniosus <sense id="n23352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ingeniosus: <entryFree id="n23353" type="main" key="inge^ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingenium</etym>, <sense id="n23353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intellectual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior in intellect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endowed with a good capacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gifted with genius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of good natural talents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abilities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23353.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles quidem ait, omnes ingeniosos melancholicos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniosi vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingeniosus et eruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quisque est solertior et ingeniosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ingeniosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dandis ingeniosa notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in aliqua re, Mart. praef. 1: in poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:342" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res est ingeniosa dare,</quote> <trans><tr>giving requires good sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23353.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things. </sense><sense id="n23353.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ingenious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23353.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adapted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vox mutandis ingeniosa sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ingeniosa colenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad segetes ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:684" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 684</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuosissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1742, 15</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wittily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingeniously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractantur ista ingeniose,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">electas res collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 6, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 13, 12, § 42</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ingeniosissime nequam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingenitus: <entryFree id="n23354" type="main" key="inge^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n23354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbegotten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n23355" type="main" key="inge^ni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕnĭtus</orth>, v. ingigno.</entryFree>
ingenium: <entryFree id="n23356" type="main" key="inge^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-geno, from gigno</etym>, <sense id="n23356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">innate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">natural quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23356.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in Sall. and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): pro ingenio ego me liberum esse ratus sum, pro imperio tuo tibi servire aequom censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: ite in frundiferos locos Ingenio arbusta ubi nata sunt, non obsita, <hi rend="ital">by their own nature</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 323, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 28 Rib.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 18</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum hominumque ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 12, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:16 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 16 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">campi suopte ingenio humentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 177</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, portūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:283" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores sui cujusque ingenii poma ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis ingenia et proprietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium velox igni, Sev. Aetn. 214: crines ingenio suo flexi,</quote> <trans><tr>naturally</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut magistratus imperio suo vehemens mansueto permitteretur ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum honesta suopte ingenio peterentur,</quote> <trans><tr>in consequence of its own nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis ingenio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctator ingenio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio trux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely of beasts: mitior ad feras bestias, praecipitia ingenia sortitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23356.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of persons. </sense><sense id="n23356.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Natural disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode of thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feci ego ingenium meum,</quote> <trans><tr>have acted out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ingenium meumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingenium est omnium hominum ab labore proclive ad lubidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pium ac pudicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum atque inexorabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lene in liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam nunc matrescam ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Con. Rel. v. 139" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Con. Rel. v. 139</bibl></cit> Rib. (1 Rib., maturescam): <cit><quote lang="la">mobile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicur et mansuetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">inverecundum animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:45:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 45, 83</bibl></cit>: vera loqui etsi meum ingenium non moneret. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio suo vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: redire ad ingenium, <hi rend="ital">to return to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s natural bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s old courses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscis levatis metu suum rediit ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: quae maxime ad muliebre ingenium efficaces<cb n="INGE" />  preces sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanum dictatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis ingenii juvenem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turni ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperare suum,</quote> <trans><tr>to control his temper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molliora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 17:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Helv. 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: ingenium ingeni, in Plautus, signifies <hi rend="ital">peculiarity of disposition</hi>, Stich. 1, 2, 69.—</sense><sense id="n23356.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr. collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto corruptius iter immixtis histrionibus et spadonum gregibus et cetero Neronianae aulae ingenio,</quote> <trans><tr>the people who gave character to the court</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23356.5" n="B" level="2"> With respect to intelligence. </sense><sense id="n23356.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Natural capacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abilities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">docilitas, memoria, quae fere appellantur uno ingenii nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium ad fingendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excellens ac singulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir acerrimo ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tanta vis ingenii est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutum aut retusum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Div. 1, 36, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcherrimum et maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebetatum, fractum, contusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres ingenii motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii vigor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii docilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio abundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio divino esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio hebeti esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo ingenium ejus elucere videbatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere et imbuere ingenium artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere multiplici variāque materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author>
