2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versabatur in hoc nostro studio cum ingenio,</quote> <trans><tr>with cleverness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii memoria immortalis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 18, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutiora ingenia et ad intellegendum aptiora eorum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (partes agrorum) quae acuta ingenia gignant, aliae quae retusa,</quote> <trans><tr>intellects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n23356.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23356.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A genius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a man of genius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenious person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepi voluntatem tam excellens ingenium fuisse in civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 40, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum magnum ingenium sine mixtura dementiae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 17:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 17, 10</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut saepe summa ingenia in occulto latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra (i. e. oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dial. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Polyb. 27:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Polyb. 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidissimus omnium magnorum ingeniorum aestimator Livius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia et artes vel maxime fovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id in magnis animis ingeniisque plerumque contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23356.9" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">an invention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clever thought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisita ingenia cenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctium suarum ingenia (= flagitiosae libidinis inventiones),</quote> <trans><tr>voluptuous inventions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingeno: <entryFree id="n23357" type="spur" key="inge^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕno</orth>, <itype>false reading for ingenioque</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 745</bibl>.</entryFree>
ingens: <entryFree id="n23358" type="main" key="ingens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-genus, gens, that goes beyond its kind or species, qs. uncouth, monstrous</etym>, <sense id="n23358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of immoderate size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormous; great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>: magnas vero agere gratias Thais mihi? <hi rend="ital">Gn.</hi> Ingentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 1</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis erat respondere magnas: ingentes inquit, semper auget assentator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">ingens immanisque praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens immensusque campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>an exorbitant sum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus Istri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:185" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus atque animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentia facta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 441" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 441</bibl></cit>: ingens aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> in any respect: <cit><quote lang="la">vir famā ingens, ingentior armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus opibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:71" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23358.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens virium atque animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl></cit> Dietsch: femina <pb n="951" /> <cb n="INGE" /> ingens animi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingens rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 66</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23358.2" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens ferre mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:216" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 216</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 124</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23358.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:67" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentis spiritus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui genus a proavis ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingenuatus: <entryFree id="n23359" type="main" key="inge^nu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭātus</orth>, v. ingeniatus.</entryFree>
ingenue: <entryFree id="n23360" type="main" key="inge^nu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ingenuus <sense id="n23360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ingenuilis: <entryFree id="n23361" type="main" key="inge^nu^i_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingenuus</etym>, <sense id="n23361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sincere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuous</hi>: AVRELIVS, Inscr. ap. Grut. 538, 9.</sense></entryFree>
ingenuinus: <entryFree id="n23362" type="main" key="inge^nu^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that belongs to an</hi> ingenuus, Inscr. ap. Grut. 8, 7.</sense></entryFree>
ingenuitas: <entryFree id="n23363" type="main" key="inge^nu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n23363.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The condition of a free-born man</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentleman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta ingenuitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assertus in ingenuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23363.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mode of thinking worthy of a freeman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble-mindedness</hi>,<hi rend="ital">frankness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble demeanor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se probitatem quandam et ingenuitatem ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare ingenuitatem et ruborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingenuus: <entryFree id="n23364" type="main" key="inge^nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingeno, ingigno</etym>. <sense id="n23364.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Native</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigenous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not foreign.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23364.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tophus,</quote> <trans><tr>produced in the country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23364.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inest in hoc amussitata sua sibi ingenua indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>natural color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23364.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Free-born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born of free parents.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23364.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: ingenuus homo meant formerly <hi rend="ital">one born of a certain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">known father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who can cite his father</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">en unquam fando audistis patricios primo esse factos, non de caelo demissos, sed qui patrem ciere possent, id est nihil ultra quam ingenuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenui clarique parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 8</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a free-born man</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woman</hi>: ingenui sunt qui liberi nati sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">libertini, qui ex justa servitute manumissi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela liberantur ingenuae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:194" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 194</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but this word differs from liber, inasmuch as the latter signifies also a freedman,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuamne an libertinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis ingenuorum adest multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: Patricios Cincius ait appellari solitos, qui nunc ingenui vocentur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=241" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 241</bibl> Müll.: libertinos ab ingenuis adoptari posse, Masur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23364.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23364.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of a freeman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuous</hi> (syn. liberalis): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil apparet in eo ingenuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: est animi ingenui (with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuis studiis atque artibus delectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with humanae) artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenui vultus puer ingenuique pudoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per gemitus nostros ingenuasque cruces,</quote> <trans><tr>and by such sufferings on the part of a freeman as belong only to slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:82:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 82, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte odisse magis ingenui est, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astuta ingenuum vulpes imitata leonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23364.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi> (free-born persons being less inured to hardships than slaves; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">invalidae vires, ingenuaeque mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:82:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 82, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingĕnŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner befitting a person of free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble birth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberally; openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte atque ingenue confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro suis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingero: <entryFree id="n23365" type="main" key="inge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n23365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> inger for ingere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n23365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23365.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna foco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid vini oleique erat, oribus ingerebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e puteis aquam in salinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23365.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n23365.4" n="1" level="3"> Ingerere se, <hi rend="ital">to betake one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rush to</hi> any place: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi confertissimos hostes pugnare conspexisset, eo se semper ingerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se morti obviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1032" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1032</bibl></cit>; cf.: se oculis, <hi rend="ital">to offer one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese periclis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23365.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To inflict upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 461" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnos alicui in ventrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to deal blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 95</bibl></cit>: verbera, Curt. <cb n="INGL" /> 6, 11, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">manus capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23365.6" n="3" level="3"> Of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:230" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas in tergum fugientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa in subeuntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas et jacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missilia in propugnantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:13" default="NO">4, 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23365.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">present to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">saginandis anseribus polentae duas partes, et furfuris quatuor ingerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nova pocula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua frigida ingesta sistitur sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>administered internally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23365.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heap</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put upon</hi> a person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Cassandreus, saucius ingestā contumuleris humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:460" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta giganteis ingesta est insula membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps pastillis ingestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 38, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summis ingestum montibus Aepy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:180" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies ingesta sopori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingesta vincula unguibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Gild. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 461" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 461</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23365.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23365.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of language. </sense><sense id="n23365.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pour forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pour out against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convicia alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumelias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis verborumque quantum voletis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23365.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep saying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem suum ingerit et inculcat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingerebat lentissima voce, Carpe, Carpe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:22:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia mala ingerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces quae plerumque verae et graves coram ingerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tribunis eadem ingerebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23365.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23365.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To obtrude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">force upon</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">ne recusanti quidem amicitiam suam ingerere destitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Hor. p. 297" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Hor. p. 297</bibl></cit> Roth: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina liberis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium filiamque orbis senibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia imperia recusanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingerebat iste Artemidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his se ingerit (Fortuna),</quote> <trans><tr>presses her favors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:609" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis tanta vis est ut nemo ... qui non videat ingerentem se oculis divinam claritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen patris patriae a populo saepius ingestum repudiavit,</quote> <trans><tr>pressed upon him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23365.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To heap up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus sceleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 731" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 731</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingestabilis: <entryFree id="n23366" type="main" key="ingesta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gestābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insupportable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 6, 5, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingestio: <entryFree id="n23367" type="main" key="ingesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingero</etym>, <sense id="n23367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>: liquentis plumbi, Cod. Th. 9, 24, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:152" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23367.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An uttering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primae vocis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 459</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingesto: <entryFree id="n23368" type="main" key="ingesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gesto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>: votum, a dub. read. in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 37</bibl>, where now intextas; v. Hildebr. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
ingestus: <entryFree id="n23369" type="main" key="ingestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ingero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23370" type="main" key="ingestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ingero</etym>, <sense id="n23370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a presenting with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestowment</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">immortalitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingigno: <entryFree id="n23371" type="main" key="ingigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gigno</orth>, <itype>gĕnŭi, gĕnĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to instil by birth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to implant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engender.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbasque nocentes rupibus ingenuit tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites ingenita sterilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23371.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura cupiditatem nomini ingenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam ingenuit animantibus conservandi sui natura custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia ingenita,</quote> <trans><tr>inborn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sic hominis natura generata sit, ut habeat quiddam ingenitum quasi civile atque populare,</quote> <trans><tr>innate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inglomero: <entryFree id="n23372" type="main" key="inglo^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-glŏmĕro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to heap together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accumulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:351" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 351</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingloriosus: <entryFree id="n23373" type="main" key="inglo_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-glōrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/docos,</foreign> <sense id="n23373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inglorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without repute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inglorius: <entryFree id="n23374" type="main" key="inglo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inglōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-gloria</etym>, <sense id="n23374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without glory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not glorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inglorious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23374.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): beati qui honorati sunt videntur; <cit><quote lang="la">miseri qui sunt inglorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latam trahens inglorius alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium, Tac A. 12, 14: vita inhouorata et ingloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 81</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23374.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:39" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23374.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingloria cassis,</quote> <trans><tr>unadorned</tr>, <tr>without a crest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inglutinatus: <entryFree id="n23375" type="gloss" key="inglu_ti^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inglūtĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not glued</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastened</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)ko/llhtos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inglutio: <entryFree id="n23376" type="main" key="inglu_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-glūtio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">glutt-</orth>), <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swallow down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 9, 9</bibl>. <cb n="INGR" /></sense></entryFree>
ingluvies: <entryFree id="n23377" type="main" key="inglu^vi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inglŭvĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a gula dicta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112</bibl> Müll.; cf. Sanscr. gar-, girami, swallow; Lat. glutire</etym>, <sense id="n23377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maw.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23377.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals, Varr. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic piscibus atram Improbus ingluviem, ranisque loquacibus explet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 431</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Anton. Imp. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Anton. Imp. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23377.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">voraciousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avi cur atque parentis Praeclaram ingratā stringat malus ingluvie rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notabilis ingluvie atque voracitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 18</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl>, read inluvies).</sense></entryFree>
ingluviosus: <entryFree id="n23378" type="gloss" key="inglu^vi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inglŭvĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingluvies</etym>, <sense id="n23378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voracious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluttonous</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=112:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 112, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ingrandesco: <entryFree id="n23379" type="main" key="ingrandesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grandesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow big</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porrum, si jam ingranduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingrate: <entryFree id="n23380" type="main" key="ingra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ingratus <sense id="n23380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ingratia: <entryFree id="n23381" type="main" key="ingra_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingratus</etym>. <sense id="n23381.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Thanklessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingratitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ingratiam incidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n23381.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭīs</orth>, or contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātīs</orth> (v. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 19</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">without one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s thanks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s will.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23381.2" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (rare, and not in class. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuis ingratiis ( = te invito),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so perh. ingratiis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis invitis atque amborum ingratiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23381.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwillingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">against his</hi> (<hi rend="ital">her</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">will</hi> (class., and in both forms): <cit><quote lang="la">id quod odio'st faciundum'st cum malo atque ingratiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1069</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extorquendum est invito atque ingratiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicent quae necesse erit, ingratiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit> Halm (Zumpt, ingratis): nisi plane cogit ingratiis, id. Tull. § 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingratis ad depugnandum omnes cogerentur,</quote> <trans><tr>against their will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so, cogere, also <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 39</bibl>. —See Hand, Turs. III. p. 379 sq.</sense></entryFree>
ingratificatio: <entryFree id="n23382" type="main" key="ingra_ti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unthankfulness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 3, p. 212.</sense></entryFree>
ingratificentia: <entryFree id="n23383" type="main" key="ingra_ti^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭfĭcentĭa</orth>, <sense id="n23383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unthankfulness</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Rusp. ad Monim. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingratificus: <entryFree id="n23384" type="hapax" key="ingra_ti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ingratusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n23384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unthankful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungrateful</hi>: Argivi, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:57:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 57, 122</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 364 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
ingratiis: <entryFree id="n23385" type="main" key="ingra_ti^i_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭīs</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātīs</orth>, v. ingratia, II.</entryFree>
ingratitudo: <entryFree id="n23386" type="main" key="ingra_ti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingratus</etym>. <sense id="n23386.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unthankfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingratitude</hi> (late Lat. for animus ingratus), Firm. 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23386.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Displeasure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingratus: <entryFree id="n23387" type="main" key="ingra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23387.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n23387.1" n="A" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">bene quae in me fecerunt, ingrata habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem ingrata esse sentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: fuit haec oratio non ingrata Gallis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratam Veneri pone superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:738" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23387.2" n="B" level="2"> Of persons: non ingratus, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetulicus exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit> (30). —</sense><sense id="n23387.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unthankful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungrateful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23387.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratus est, qui beneficium accepisse se negat, quod accepit: ingratus qui dissimulat: ingratus qui non reddit: ingratissimus omnium, qui oblitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cognovi ingratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrati animi crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratum esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 50, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir adversus merita Caesaris ingratissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nihil amas, quom ingratum amas,</quote> <trans><tr>irresponsive</tr>, <tr>who makes no return</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23387.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <trans><tr>not grateful for his preservation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 666</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23387.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that receives no thanks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata atque inrita esse omnia intellego quae dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:700" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 700</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23387.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things that do not repay the trouble bestowed upon them, <hi rend="ital">ungrateful</hi>: ager, <hi rend="ital">that</hi> <pb n="952" /> <cb n="INGR" /> <hi rend="ital">bears nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 47, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignosces tamen post, et id ingratum,</quote> <trans><tr>you will get no thanks for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratā ingluvie rem stringere (i. e. quae numquam satiatur, numquam acceptis contenta est),</quote> <trans><tr>insatiable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrato vocem prostituisse foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier contra patronum suum ingrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23387.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unpleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrate viridis gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus ingrate timida indulgentia servit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ingrate nominando Varrone,</quote> <trans><tr>not unwillingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 23</bibl></cit> (al. in grege).— </sense><sense id="n23387.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unthankfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungratefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrate nostra facilitate abutuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive a thing with unthankfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sucus qui ingrate his (pomis vitiosis) posset impendi, ad meliora vertatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingravate: <entryFree id="n23388" type="main" key="ingra^va_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grăvātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not grudgingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">willingly</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ingravatio: <entryFree id="n23389" type="main" key="ingra^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrăvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingravo</etym>, <sense id="n23389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 13, 7.</sense></entryFree>
ingravesco: <entryFree id="n23390" type="main" key="ingra^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grăvesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n23390.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque gravescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1250</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become heavier.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23390.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora exercitationum defatigatione ingravescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal vix incredibili pondere ingravescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipiunt aliae pondus magis inque gravescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23390.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to increase; grow worse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become burdensome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingravescens morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingravescens aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora exercitationum defetigatione ingravescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc studium quotidie ingravescit,</quote> <trans><tr>grows more serious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter in dies ingravescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: annona, <hi rend="ital">provisions grow dearer</hi>, Auct. Or. pro Domo, 5, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">Verania mox ingravescit, clamat moriens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsis (rumoribus) ingravescebat,</quote> <trans><tr>by false reports he sank deeper and deeper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingravido: <entryFree id="n23391" type="main" key="ingra^vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grăvĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (late Lat.). <sense id="n23391.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coëuntes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 24, 352</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23391.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppress.</hi>—<mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrăvĭ-dātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ingravis: <entryFree id="n23392" type="spur" key="ingra^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grăvis</orth>, <itype>false reading for in gravi</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 3</bibl>.</entryFree>
ingravo: <entryFree id="n23393" type="main" key="ingra^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grăvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). <sense id="n23393.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:402" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 402</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23393.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23393.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause its weight to be felt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia hiemis ingravat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 51, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis ingravantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23393.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To render worse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aggravate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingravat haec saevus Drances,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa meos casus ingravat, illa levat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23393.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make severe</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingravavit cor suum,</quote> <trans><tr>he hardened his heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 8, 15</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 7, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ingredior: <entryFree id="n23394" type="main" key="ingre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>essus 3</itype>, (in tmesi: <sense id="n23394.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ut velit ire inque gredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:888" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 888</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. in-gradior] </sense><sense id="n23394.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> (class.; syn. intro, introeo). </sense><sense id="n23394.2" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stadium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in antiquum fundum ingredi vellet, frequentes armati obstiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem Mulvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via, quam nobis quoque ingrediendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:1 al" default="NO">9, 10, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n23394.4" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">intra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrediens intra finem ejus loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi intra munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra fines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.5" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris ingressus Etruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 148</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23394.6" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos (sc. deos penates) paulo ante ingressus hospitaliter fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n23394.8" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in vitam paulo serius, tanquam in viam, ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:330" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ingrediar in disputationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: in eam rationem, <cb n="INGR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 213</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caecin. 12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecin. 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem publicam,</quote> <trans><tr>to engage in public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 22" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.9" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">simple acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque viam vivendi sit ingressurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc video mihi principem ad ingrediendam rationem horum studiorum exstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquendi rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § 3.— </sense><sense id="n23394.10" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad discendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi> an action, speech, etc. </sense><sense id="n23394.12" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam sum ingressus eas res mandare monumentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">describere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versare dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 704</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sic contra est ingressa Venus, <hi rend="ital">thus began Venus</hi> (to speak), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anchises lacrimis ingressus obortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 867</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.14" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam orationem cum ingressus essem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi res antiquae laudis et artis Ingredior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquam profectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.15" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ingressum in sermonem Pompeius interpellavit,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of his speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. 1, 2, 2.— </sense><sense id="n23394.16" n="D" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar decimum nonum annum ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:61:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 61, 1</bibl></cit>: ingresso vere, <hi rend="ital">when spring has begun</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arrived</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = incedo.— Prop., <hi rend="ital">to go along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23394.18" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: si stas, ingredere; <cit><quote lang="la">si ingrederis, curre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.19" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex pedes per nivem et glaciem ingredi coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23394.20" n="3" level="3"> With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quacumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:481" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti gregatim ingrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 5, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.21" n="4" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 177</bibl></cit>; 10, 767.— </sense><sense id="n23394.22" n="B" level="2"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">to walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23394.23" n="1" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>; for which, </sense><sense id="n23394.24" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia patris,</quote> <trans><tr>to follow</tr>, <tr>walk in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:53:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 53, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.25" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per titulos ingredimurque tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23394.26" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimia debent ingredi, lenia duci, acria currere, delicata fluere,</quote> <trans><tr>to march majestically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tragoedia socco ingreditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingressio: <entryFree id="n23395" type="main" key="ingressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingredior</etym>, <sense id="n23395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entering</hi> (Ciceron.). </sense><sense id="n23395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ingressione fori,</quote> <trans><tr>entrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23395.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum cursus est in oratione incitatior, interdum moderata ingressio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:59:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 59, 201</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23395.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima ingressio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingressus: <entryFree id="n23396" type="main" key="ingressus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an entrance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23396.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba ad ingressum tuum te consalutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes">22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in ipso ingressu meo (sc. in provinciam) scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:ad Traj. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. ad Traj. 17, 4</bibl></cit>.— Esp. </sense><sense id="n23396.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hostile entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus hostiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23396.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A going</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gait</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus, cursus, accubitio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohiberi ingressu,</quote> <trans><tr>were prevented from moving</tr>, <tr>could not stir a step</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">instabilemque ingressum praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praebere ingressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Stat. 3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Stat. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam terrae ad ingressus tremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 94, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 51</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23396.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the way into a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trini ingressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 843</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus quod Horatius arcet ingressu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 6</bibl></cit> ep. — </sense><sense id="n23396.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an entering upon</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ingressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ingressu (causae) ac fine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: in ingresssu operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannensis pugnae temerarius ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingruens: <entryFree id="n23397" type="main" key="ingru^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrŭens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ingruo.</entryFree>
