ingruo: <entryFree id="n23398" type="main" key="ingru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingrŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-ruo, with an epenth. <hi rend="ital">g</hi> from gruo, kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">krou/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n23398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">break into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall violently upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi> (syn. incumbo; differing from <cb n="INHA" /> immineo and impendo, in that it denotes the actual doing of that which they merely threaten; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n23398.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hostes crebri cadunt; <cit><quote lang="la">nostri contra ingruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruit Aeneas Italis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 628</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruere hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 899</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ingruunt saxa jaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruentes accusatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruente in Italiam Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23398.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreus ingruit imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingruere morbi in remiges coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bellum ingrueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 535</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullus ingruat metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid subitum ingruat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inguen: <entryFree id="n23399" type="main" key="inguen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inguen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (also late Lat. <orth extent="full" lang="la">inguĭ-na</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 6, 19</bibl>), <sense id="n23399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the front part of the body between the hips.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23399.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The groin.</hi>— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentum destillat ab inguine virus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 281</bibl></cit>; more freq. <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">candida succincta inguina (Scylla),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem atque inguina hausit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n23399.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The privy members</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:346" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:370 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 370 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n23399.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A swelling in the groin</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">a swelling on the knee</hi>, Fronto ad Marc. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 5</bibl>, ep. 44 Mai.— </sense><sense id="n23399.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The abdomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legenti suffodit inguina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:900" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 900</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23399.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">the place where a branch is joined to the stem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:153" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 21, 35, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inguina: <entryFree id="n23400" type="main" key="ingui^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inguĭna</orth>, v. inguen <sense id="n23400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inguinalis: <entryFree id="n23401" type="main" key="ingui^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inguĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inguen</etym>, <sense id="n23401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> inguen: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 9, 59, § 92</bibl></cit> (al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">inguĭnārĭus</orth>); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inguiomerus: <entryFree id="n23402" type="main" key="Ingui^ome^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Inguĭomĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prince of the Germans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arminii patruus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ingurgitatio: <entryFree id="n23403" type="main" key="ingurgi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingurgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ingurgito</etym>, <sense id="n23403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immoderate eating and drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guzzling</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
ingurgito: <entryFree id="n23404" type="main" key="ingurgi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingurgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-gurges</etym>, <sense id="n23404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour in</hi> like a flood or whirlpool. </sense><sense id="n23404.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum ventri suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide ut avariter merum in se ingurgitat faucibus plenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor ex nivibus non universus ingurgitans (sc. se), diluensque, sed destillans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23404.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus palude sese ingurgitat, nomine Lemanno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23404.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To glut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gorge one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self with meat and drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gormandize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guzzle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se caeno (of swine),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudique postridie se rursus ingurgitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium crebris et ingentibus poculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, ingurgitari, <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self drunk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get drunk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus ingurgitata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeto ingurgitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23404.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to engage deeply in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be absorbed in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to addict</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in flagitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in alicujus copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui degustandum ex philosophia censet, non in eam ingurgitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 16, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 340" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 340</bibl> Rib. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
ingustabilis: <entryFree id="n23405" type="main" key="ingusta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ingustābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-gusto</etym>, <sense id="n23405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be tasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not fit to be eaten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drunk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacae omnibus animantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 43, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingustatus: <entryFree id="n23406" type="hapax" key="ingusta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gustātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">untasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not tasted before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia rhombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingusto: <entryFree id="n23407" type="main" key="ingusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-gusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give to taste</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi sanguinem humanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ingyaeones: <entryFree id="n23408" type="main" key="Ingyaeo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ingyaeŏnes</orth> (v. Ingaevones), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhabilis: <entryFree id="n23409" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hăbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be managed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmanageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwieldy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23409.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis inhabilis prope magnitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum inhabile ad remittendum imperitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 34, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">telum pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhabiles vastorum corporum moles (of elephants),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod et ipsis vetustate militiae exercitatum, et hostibus inhabile,</quote> <trans><tr>awkward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23409.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unfit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unapt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incapable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Oecon. 4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. Oecon. 4</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere aliquem inhabilem studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">progenerandis esse fetibus inhabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: boves <pb n="953" /> <cb n="INHA" /> labori et culturae non inhabiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calori non inhabile,</quote> <trans><tr>fit to express</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:146" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 1, 2 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n23409.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo inhabilis ad consensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:12:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 12, 16, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23409.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhabiles rempublicam tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhabitabilis: <entryFree id="n23410" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^ta_bi^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hăbĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uninhabitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: Indi ostia inhabitabilia, Mela, 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23411" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^ta_bi^lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhăbĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inhabito</etym>, <sense id="n23411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhabitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inhabitabiles oras terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhabitaculum: <entryFree id="n23412" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^ta_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhăbĭtācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwelling-place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhabitat inhabitaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhabitatio: <entryFree id="n23413" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhăbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habitation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Marc. 3, 24</bibl>; id. ex Gen. 27, 40.</sense></entryFree>
inhabitator: <entryFree id="n23414" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhăbĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitant</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Helv. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhabito: <entryFree id="n23415" type="main" key="i^nha^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hăbĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dwell in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inhabit</hi> (post-Aug. for habito, incolo). </sense><sense id="n23415.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhabitatur illa regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dorienses oceani locos inhabitasse confines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobile solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhăbĭ-tantes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23415.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of garments, <hi rend="ital">to wear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
inhaeredito: <entryFree id="n23416" type="main" key="i^nhaere_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-haerēdĭto</orth>, etc., v. inheredito, etc.</entryFree>
inhaereo: <entryFree id="n23417" type="main" key="i^nhaere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-haerĕo</orth>, <itype>haesi, haesum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stick in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cleave to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adhere to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhere in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23417.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23417.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera suis sedibus inhaerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi, qui corporibus non inhaerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantior quam nova collibus arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupati regni finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:129:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 129, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prioribus vestigiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>continues in his former path</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 403</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23417.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad saxa inhaerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23417.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rei natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 163</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23417.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux umeris abeuntis inhaerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoribus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 54</bibl></cit>. — (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: inhaesuro similis (canis), <hi rend="ital">as if about to hang on the hare</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fasten on her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 535</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram amplexus inhaesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 124</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23417.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cling to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage deeply</hi> or <hi rend="ital">closely in; to be closely connected with</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhaeret in mentibus quoddam augurium,</quote> <trans><tr>is inherent in our minds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinatio inhaerens et penitus insita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes semper voluptatibus inhaerent,</quote> <trans><tr>are always connected with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultibus illa tuis, tanquam praesentis inhaeret,</quote> <trans><tr>she hangs upon your features</tr>, <tr>gazes at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoribus tu nostris inhaeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis animisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene stulta est inhaerentium oculis ingeniorum enumeratio,</quote> <trans><tr>that are before the eyes</tr>, <tr>plainly to be seen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa meis oculis species abeuntis inhaeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excidere proxima, vetera inhaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae inhaerent fidelius quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: scio memoriae tuae preces nostras inhaerere, Plin. et Traj. Ep. 12, 1: studiis, <hi rend="ital">to apply one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio operatus inhaesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 865</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to be always about one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysippum statuae unius lineamentis inhaerentem, inopia exstinxit,</quote> <trans><tr>constantly intent upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conpendendis rebus pertinaciter inhaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be obstinately bent on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pejores inhaesimus laqueos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhaeresco: <entryFree id="n23418" type="main" key="i^nhaeresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhaeresco</orth>, <itype>haesi, haesum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [inhaereo], <hi rend="ital">to stick fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23418.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sordibus aurium, tamquam in visco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid emineret ubi ignis hostium inhaeresceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus villis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 74</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23418.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae inhaerescunt penitus in mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhaesio: <entryFree id="n23419" type="main" key="i^nhaesi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhaesĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hanging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adhering to</hi>, Aug. Conf.</sense></entryFree>
inhalatus: <entryFree id="n23420" type="main" key="i^nha_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhālātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inhalo</etym>, <sense id="n23420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breathing at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 119, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhalo: <entryFree id="n23421" type="main" key="i^nha_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hālo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="INHI" /> 20: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui popinam,</quote> <trans><tr>the smell of food that has been eaten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23421.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To breathe the odor</hi> of something: inhalantes horti floribus, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 21, 69. —</sense><sense id="n23421.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe upon</hi>, as a magical rite: <cit><quote lang="la">surculis et lapillis inhalatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 116, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhamo: <entryFree id="n23422" type="main" key="i^nha_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hāmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>hamus</etym>, <sense id="n23422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten by a hook.</hi>—Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inheredito: <entryFree id="n23423" type="main" key="i^nhe_re_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hērēdĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">haer-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appoint an heir</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 4</bibl> Esdr. 7, 67.</sense></entryFree>
inheredo: <entryFree id="n23424" type="main" key="i^nhe_re_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhērēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">haer-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>heres</etym>, <sense id="n23424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appoint as an heir</hi> (late Lat.), Salv. contra Avar. 2, p. 384.</sense></entryFree>
inhianter: <entryFree id="n23425" type="main" key="i^nhi^anter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhĭanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>inhio</etym>, <sense id="n23425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with open mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eagerly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid inhianter haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 8</bibl></cit>: ardescere, id. ep. 112, 8.</sense></entryFree>
inhiatio: <entryFree id="n23426" type="main" key="i^nhi^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening of the mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaping</hi>, e. g. in astonishment (late Lat.), Treb. Poll. Gall. 9.</sense></entryFree>
inhibeo: <entryFree id="n23427" type="main" key="i^nhi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-habeo</etym>, <sense id="n23427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay hold of</hi> a thing, in order to keep it back or to put it forward. </sense><sense id="n23427.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23427.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelissimas manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:849" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 40, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <trans><tr>to cease rowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § 4: inhibere, or inhibere remis, or inhibere remis puppim, or inhibere retro navem, <hi rend="ital">to row the ship backwards without turning it round;</hi> cf.: inhibere est verbum totum nauticum: sed arbitrabar sustineri remos, cum inhibere essent jussi remiges. Id non esse ejusmodi, didici heri ... non enim sustinent, sed alio modo remigant: id ab <foreign lang="greek">e)poxh=|</foreign> remotissimum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>. (Cicero himself has used the term in the incorrect signif. here found fault with: <cit><quote lang="la">Ut concitato navigio, cum remiges inhibuerunt, retinet tamen ipsa navis motum et cursum suum, intermisso impetu pulsuque remorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 153</bibl></cit>.) In the foll. passages it is used in its proper acceptation: <cit><quote lang="la">cum divellere se ab hoste cupientes inhiberent Rhodii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite cessim inhibete remis, et a bello discedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii inhibentes remis aegre evellere navem quae haerebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro navem inhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam inhibent remis puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 659</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23427.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhibit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum victoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108</bibl></cit>: urentis oculos, <hi rend="ital">blasting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evil eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23427.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Ab aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a turpi mente inhibere probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:91:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 91, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23427.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen potuit inhibere (Cato), quominus Romae quoque ponerentur (statuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 14, § 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23427.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibentur rectum agere cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibenda tamen est (mater mori),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1030" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1030</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 18</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23427.7" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes in the sense of adhibere, exercere, <hi rend="ital">to set in operation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine hic pacto potest inhibere imperium magister,</quote> <trans><tr>exert authority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum fontine an Libero imperium te inhibere mavis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium in deditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium si quis inhiberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque animis ad imperium inhibendum imminutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem supplicia alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict the same punishment on one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 18, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coërcitionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhibitio: <entryFree id="n23428" type="hapax" key="i^nhi^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhĭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhibeo</etym>, <sense id="n23428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restraining</hi>: remigum, <hi rend="ital">a rowing backwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibitio autem remigum motum habet, et vehementiorem quidem remigationis navem convertentis ad puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; v. inhibeo, I. A.</sense></entryFree>
inhibitus: <entryFree id="n23429" type="main" key="i^nhi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inhibeo.</entryFree>
inhinnio: <entryFree id="n23430" type="main" key="i^nhinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to neigh at</hi> (late Lat.): puellis, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhio: <entryFree id="n23431" type="main" key="i^nhi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23431.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n23431.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora inhiasse luporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:626" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 626</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23431.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gape</hi> with amazement, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">inhians Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attonitis inhians animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 814</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23431.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to open the mouth wide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gape at.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23431.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus lactens, uberibus lupinis inhians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gazis inhians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 166" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:531" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 531</bibl></cit>: pecudumque reclusis<cb n="INHO" />  Pectoribus inhians, spirantia consu, lit exta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <trans><tr>to gape at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 463</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23431.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to gaze at with eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regard with longing</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capto, appeto, sitio): congestis saccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhians in te, dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 59 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:22:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quibus vulgus inhiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 102, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <trans><tr>to hear eagerly</tr>, <tr>attend closely to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:469" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 469</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ter. 1</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare, except in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: mortem alicujus, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhiat quod nusquam est miser,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhisco: <entryFree id="n23432" type="main" key="inhisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-hisco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, i. q. inhio: inhisco <foreign lang="greek">e)pixai/nw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
inhonestamentum: <entryFree id="n23433" type="main" key="i^nho^nesta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnestāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inhonesto</etym>, <sense id="n23433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shame</hi> (ante- and postclass.): pueritia tua adulescentiae tuae inhonestamentum fuit, Gracch. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 275, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonestas: <entryFree id="n23434" type="main" key="i^nho^nestas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhonestus</etym>, <sense id="n23434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonestatio: <entryFree id="n23435" type="main" key="i^nho^nesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhonesto</etym>, <sense id="n23435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dishonoring</hi>, Hier.</sense></entryFree>
inhoneste: <entryFree id="n23436" type="main" key="i^nho^neste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inhonestus.</entryFree>
inhonesto: <entryFree id="n23437" type="hapax" key="i^nho^nesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inhonestus</etym>, <sense id="n23437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmas adeptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonestus: <entryFree id="n23438" type="main" key="i^nho^nestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23438.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dishonorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eho, impure, inhoneste, labes popli!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotā matre inhonestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus nobis non inhonestus,</quote> <trans><tr>inglorious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:58" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 58</bibl></cit> (3, 22, 38 Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 89</bibl></cit> (2, 8 b, 27 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostes) inhonesta vulnera tergo accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:211" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vitellius gulā et ventre sibi inhonestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 31</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil injustum atque inhonestum, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 41: quid hoc joco inhonestius,</quote> <trans><tr>more indecent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhonestissima cupiditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. Fr. 1, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo turpissimus atque inhonestissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23438.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unseemly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 16</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgracefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parere divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">submitti alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with improbe) facere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:19:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonorabilis: <entryFree id="n23439" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhonored</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonoratio: <entryFree id="n23440" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnōrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhonoro</etym>, <sense id="n23440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dishonoring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 1, 38</bibl>; Hilar. Trin. 4, 41.</sense></entryFree>
inhonoratus: <entryFree id="n23441" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. inhonoro <sense id="n23441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inhonorificus: <entryFree id="n23442" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnōrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum dictumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonoris: <entryFree id="n23443" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-honorus</etym>, <sense id="n23443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhonored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse quoque non inhonoris hoc labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:35" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 35</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
inhonoro: <entryFree id="n23444" type="main" key="i^nho^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inhonorus</etym>, <sense id="n23444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fug. in Persec. 5</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnōrā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n23444.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unhonored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disregarded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita inhonorata et ingloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhonoratior triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: inhonorata dea, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to whom no incense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offerings are brought</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem grammaticam inhonoratam transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23444.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unrewarded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inhonoratum dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium Graeciae gentium inhonoratissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhonorus: <entryFree id="n23445" type="main" key="i^nho^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŏnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not respected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of no account</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 24, 28, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom no divine honors are paid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 5, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans><tr>disfigured</tr>, <tr>defaced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 62</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23445.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unsightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:391" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 391</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŏnōrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dishonorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhorreo: <entryFree id="n23446" type="main" key="i^nhorre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-horrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand on end</hi>, <pb n="954" /> <cb n="INHU" /> <hi rend="ital">stand erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bristle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud secus quam vallo saepta inhorreret acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicea jam campis cum messis inhorruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper pilis inhorrentibus corio squalidus,</quote> <trans><tr>bristling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23446.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23446.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have a tremulous motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shudder</hi>: pennis agitatus inhorruit aër. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhorruit aether, Luctificum clangente tuba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:348" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhorruit unda tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23446.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to bristle up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper inhorruit armos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 711</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23446.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shudder</hi>, with cold, fear, horror: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primum aliquis inhorruit et ex horrore incaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhorrui frigore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17</bibl></cit>: in severitatem alicujus, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 423, 6</bibl> (Rep. 4, 6 B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">domus principis inhorruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Mercurius) tenui exceptus inhorruit aurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:309" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 309</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhorresco: <entryFree id="n23447" type="main" key="i^nhorresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-horresco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n23447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send forth sharp points</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bristle up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23447.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae inhorrescunt edito ovo excutiuntque sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl></cit>: inhorrescit mare, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 411 Rib.): mobilibus veris inhorruit Adventus foliis (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for folia inhorrescunt, varie agitantur auris vernis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 5</bibl>, v. Orell. ad h. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">frigorum impatientia papiliones villis inhorrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trifolium inhorrescere et folia contra tempestatem subrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 89, § 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlas nemoribus inhorrescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23447.3" n="A" level="2"> With fever, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida potio inutilis est iis qui facile inhorrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—With cold: <cit><quote lang="la">aër nivibus et glacie inhorrescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Mund. p. 58, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tristis hiems aquilonis inhorruit alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:199" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 199</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23447.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To quake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shudder</hi>, with fear, horror, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 172, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo inhorrescit vacuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3</bibl></cit>. 85; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo rebus accommodanda compositio, ut asperis asperos etiam numeros adhiberi oporteat, et cum dicente aeque audientem inhorrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:126" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 126</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shudder at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatis vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 24" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhortor: <entryFree id="n23448" type="main" key="i^nhortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hortor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi> to a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui canes,</quote> <trans><tr>to set on</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 9</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hortātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, with <hi rend="ital">pass. signif.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes in eorum exitium inhortati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhospitalis: <entryFree id="n23449" type="main" key="i^nhospi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hospĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhospitable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23449.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 215" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 215</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23449.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontus Euxinus antea ab inhospitali feritate Axenos appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 6 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">1.—Of a tree that does not admit of ingrafting: duritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 104</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inhospĭtālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inhospitably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inhospitalitas: <entryFree id="n23450" type="main" key="i^nhospi^ta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhospĭtālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhospitalis</etym>, <sense id="n23450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhospitality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inhospitalitas sit opinio vehemens, valde fugiendum esse hospitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhospitus: <entryFree id="n23451" type="main" key="i^nhospi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hospĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhospitable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23451.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta et inhospita tesqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra Baccho,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>not bearing the vine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:237" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 237</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23451.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhospĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">inhospitable regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta inter inhospita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:753" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per inhospita ducere vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 308</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhostus: <entryFree id="n23452" type="spur" key="i^nhostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhostus</orth>, false read. in Tac. for inhonestus, v. Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 31</bibl>.</entryFree>
inhumanatio: <entryFree id="n23453" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being made man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incarnation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unigeniti Dei Filii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit> and 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inhumanatus: <entryFree id="n23454" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_na_tu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānātŭs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>in-humanus</etym>, <sense id="n23454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incarnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jesus Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhumane: <entryFree id="n23455" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inhumanus <sense id="n23455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inhumanitas: <entryFree id="n23456" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inhumanus</etym>, <sense id="n23456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhumanity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23456.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inhuman conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas inhumanitasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 12, 32</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23456.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of good breeding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23456.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Incivility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impoliteness</hi>: quod ego non superbia neque inhumanitate faciebam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23456.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unkindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disobligingness;</hi> opp. officiosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23456.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Surliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">churlishness</hi>: importunitas et inhumanitas<cb n="INIC" />  omni aetati mofesta est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23456.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Niggardliness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(populus Rom.) non amat profusas epulas, sordes et inhumanitatem multo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhumaniter: <entryFree id="n23457" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inhumanus <sense id="n23457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inhumano: <entryFree id="n23458" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmāno</orth>, v. inhumanatus.</entryFree>
inhumanus: <entryFree id="n23459" type="main" key="i^nhu_ma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hūmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not suitable to the human condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that does not befit a human being.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23459.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inhuman.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23459.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam fuit durus et ferreus, quis tam inhumanus, qui non illorum miseria commoveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with corpses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitas,</quote> <trans><tr>that enjoyed itself during the slaughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>cruel</tr>, <tr>unjust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 107</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23459.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncivil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-bred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">churlish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourteous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis contumacior, quis inhumanior, quis superbior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderati nec difficiles, nec inhumani senes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at hoc idem si in convivio faciat, inhumanus videatur,</quote> <trans><tr>ill-bred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestis et inhumana neglegentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo inhumanissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23459.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Superhuman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">godlike</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Soc. 5, p. 44, 24</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n23459.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhūmānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inhumanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savagely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruelly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis graviter cruciat adulescentulum, nimisque inhumane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere contraque naturae legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta (oratio),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 16</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumanius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23459.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hūmānĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">uncivilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourteously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miratum esse istum tam inhumaniter fecisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. (where the MSS. have inhumane).</sense></entryFree>
inhumatus: <entryFree id="n23460" type="main" key="i^nhu^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnhŭmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-humo</etym>, <sense id="n23460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not inhumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unburied</hi>: ossuum inhumatūm aestuosam aulam, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 710</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 102 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">is cum esset projectus inhumatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 69, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 820</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhumectus: <entryFree id="n23461" type="main" key="i^nhu_mectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hūmectus</orth>, <itype>a, unc</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not moist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:207" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inhumigo: <entryFree id="n23462" type="hapax" key="i^nhu_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hūmĭgo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to moisten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wet</hi>: campum totum, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 62, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 2 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
inhumo: <entryFree id="n23463" type="main" key="i^nhu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-hŭmo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bury in the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover with earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inhume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inibi: <entryFree id="n23464" type="main" key="i^ni^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">therein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23464.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, <hi rend="ital">in that place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia nata inibi (Capuae) esse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marsupium habeat, inibi paulum praesidii,</quote> <trans><tr>in that matter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R.
