R. 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inibi (i. e. in eodem libro) iisdem laudibus non invenuste lusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23464.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23464.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the point of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitae postremo, cum jam inibi mors occuparet,</quote> <trans><tr>when he was on the point of dying</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23464.4" n="B" level="2"> Inibi est, for in eo est, <hi rend="ital">it is near at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will soon take place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sperare debemus aut inibi esse, aut jam esse confectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: profecto aut inibi est aut jam potiuntur Frugum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 205 Rib.): liberne es? non sum: verum inibi est, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 23</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 189 Rib.)</sense></entryFree>
inicio: <entryFree id="n23465" type="main" key="i_ni^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īnĭcĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">injĭcĭo</orth>, v. Brambach's Hilfsb. p. 19), jēci, jectum (endojacito for inicito, Leg. XII. Tab. ap. Fest. in struere, p. 313, a, Müll.: <sense id="n23465.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">injexit for injecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-jacio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n23465.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mea domus ardebat ignibus injectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 31, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> 3: <cit><quote lang="la">foculo manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>; hence: inicere se, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fling one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">se in medios hostes ad perspicuam mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:24:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 24, 64</bibl></cit>: se in ignem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese medium in agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese morti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 143</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23465.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> any thing.— In gen.: <cb n="INIM" /> pallium inice in me huc, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eique laneum pallium injecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam ex integro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 389</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia caelo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securim alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo super tigna sesquipedalia iniciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas ad fastigia tectorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiranti pulvinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicibus laqueum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecti umeris capilli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>falling over her shoulders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 770</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23465.3" n="C" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n23465.4" n="1" level="3"> Inicere manum alicui, <hi rend="ital">to lay one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hand on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take hold of any one</hi>, in order to make him stand still, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23465.5" n="2" level="3"> In a jurid. sense, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, as one's property, without a previous judicial decision (which was permitted, e. g. to a master on meeting with his runaway slave; <cit><quote lang="la">v. injectio): virgini venienti in forum minister decemviri manum injecit, servā suā natam appellans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:9 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 7, 9 al.</bibl>—So too in summoning before a judge: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quadruplator quempiam injexit (injecerit) manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23465.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23465.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inicere tumultum civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui formidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui mentem ut audeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cogitationem de triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alacritatem et studium pugnandi exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum alicui in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultis hoc certamen uxoribus vestris inicere?</quote> <trans><tr>to give occasion for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma regnis, i. e. bellum inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:241" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustrationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to produce deception</tr>, <tr>confusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui causam deliberandi,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga injecta petitioni,</quote> <trans><tr>given</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23465.8" n="b" level="4"> Of the mind, with se, <hi rend="ital">to dwell upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflect on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam (magnitudinem regionum) se iniciens animus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23465.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23465.10" n="1" level="3"> Manus inicere (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to seize upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise power over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus sacer et aeternus est, et cui non possint inici manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quieti ejus injeci manum,</quote> <trans><tr>I have torn him away from his repose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecere manum Parcae,</quote> <trans><tr>took possession of him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 419</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23465.11" n="2" level="3"> Inicere, <hi rend="ital">to throw out a hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nuper injecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 68</bibl></cit>: Bruto cum saepe injecissem de <foreign lang="greek">o(moploi/a|,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 3</bibl>: cum mihi in sermone injecisset, se velle, etc., Trebon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui nomen alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inidonee: <entryFree id="n23466" type="spur" key="i^ni^do_ne^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĭdōnĕē</orth>, false read. in App. for idonee.</entryFree>
iniens: <entryFree id="n23467" type="main" key="i^ni^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭens</orth>, <itype>euntis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. ineo.</entryFree>
inigo: <entryFree id="n23468" type="main" key="i^ni^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-ago</etym>. <sense id="n23468.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grege jumentorum inacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:52:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: equum in oves, Fronto ad M. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 2</bibl>, ep. 15 Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">feras ad nocendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 103:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, B. Parth. p. 203" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, B. Parth. p. 203</bibl></cit> Mai.— </sense><sense id="n23468.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi> anywhere: <cit><quote lang="la">anus repentino pulsu nutantem ac pendulum praeceps inegit,</quote> <trans><tr>pushed him down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4</bibl></cit> ante med. p. 148, 12.</sense></entryFree>
inimicalis: <entryFree id="n23469" type="main" key="i^ni^mi_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inimicus</etym>, <sense id="n23469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inimical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">stimuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inimice: <entryFree id="n23470" type="main" key="i^ni^mi_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcĭter</orth>, <sense id="n23470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. inimicus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inimicitia: <entryFree id="n23471" type="main" key="i^ni^mi_ci^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inimicus</etym>, <sense id="n23471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostility</hi>, usu. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere inimicitias in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercedunt mihi inimicitiae cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant ei veteres inimicitiae cum Rosciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias insitas habere et gerere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiare alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias suas donare rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: inimicitias suas temporibus rei publicae permittere,<pb n="955" /> <cb n="ININ" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiles inter eos,</quote> <trans><tr>well known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 45, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias habere conceptas ex aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatas ulcisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitales,</quote> <trans><tr>deadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: mortales, <hi rend="ital">transient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporary</hi> (opp. amicitiae inmortales), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23471.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitia (est) ira ulciscendi tempus observans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 16</bibl>: miscent inter sese inimicitiam agitantes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 275 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aeque inimicitiam atque amicitiam in frontem promptam gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib. 19:8:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 8, 6</bibl></cit> (Trag. v. 8 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo reveni ex inimicitia in gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:15" default="NO">5, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inimico: <entryFree id="n23472" type="main" key="i^ni^mi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inimicus</etym>, <sense id="n23472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make enemies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set at variance</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">miseras inimicat urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles inimicant classica turmas,</quote> <trans><tr>urge on to fight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:419" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">desine inimicari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 28, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inimicus: <entryFree id="n23473" type="main" key="i^ni^mi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n23473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmī-cūm</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 14</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-amicus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unfriendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23473.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n23473.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eos infenso animo atque inimico venisse dicatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 21</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam inimico vultu intuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter omnia inimica infestaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius inimicus est nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 28</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal nomini Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum motus inimicissimi mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23473.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raphani dentibus inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naves) accipiunt inimicum imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor nervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritare ulmos nisi validas inimicum (est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 203</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam inimicius quam illa (oratio) versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:194" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 9</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica stomacho inimicissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 38, § 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23473.4" n="2" level="3"> Like hostilis, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne,</quote> <trans><tr>spoils of a vanquished foe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 944</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura inimica inter se esse liberam civitatem et regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostili terra, inter omnia inimica infestaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 39, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23473.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23473.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:24:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 24, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis plenior inimicorum fuit C. Mario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alc. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem insectari tamquam inimicum et hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternus,</quote> <trans><tr>hereditary</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23473.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭ-mīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusquam inimica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 13, 32</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vidit fortissimum virum inimicissimum suum, certissimum consulem,</quote> <trans><tr>greatest enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 410, and v. iniquus, II. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n23473.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unfriendly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide quam tecum agam non inimice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectari aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestius aut inimicius consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicissime contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 66</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23473.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭmīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hostilely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimically</hi>: accensus, Acc. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 22</bibl>: commoti inimiciter, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 8</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1010</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inimitabilis: <entryFree id="n23474" type="main" key="i^ni^mi^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĭmĭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be imilated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inimitable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis inimitabilis humanae rationi sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcedo morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:97" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ininitiatus: <entryFree id="n23475" type="main" key="i^ni^ni^ti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ĭnĭtĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not begun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ininitiato substantiarum cardine (al. in initiato),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inintelligibilis: <entryFree id="n23476" type="main" key="i^nintelli^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-intellĭgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unintelligible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei splendor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ininterpretabilis: <entryFree id="n23477" type="main" key="i^ninterpre^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-interprĕtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inexplicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 5, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ininterpretatus: <entryFree id="n23478" type="main" key="i^ninterpre^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-interprĕtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uninterpreted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexplained</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ininterpretatum (al. non interpretatum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ininventibilis: <entryFree id="n23479" type="main" key="i^ninventi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-inventĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-invenio</etym>,<cb n="INIQ" />  <sense id="n23479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be found out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscrutable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ininvestigabilis: <entryFree id="n23480" type="main" key="i^ninvesti_ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-investīgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsearchable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ininvicem: <entryFree id="n23481" type="main" key="i^ninvi^cem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-invĭcem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not by turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continually</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inique: <entryFree id="n23482" type="main" key="i^ni_que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. iniquus <sense id="n23482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iniquitas: <entryFree id="n23483" type="main" key="i^ni_qui^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n23483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> iniquitatium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>iniquus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unequalness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23483.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23483.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unevenness</hi>, of the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in talibus iniquitatibus locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23483.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inequality</hi>, of weight: <cit><quote lang="la">ponderis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23483.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excessiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that exceeds one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23483.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23483.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unfavorableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanta rerum iniquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum iniquitate pressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter iniquitatem temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with acerbitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 29, 81</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23483.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unfairness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injustice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitas, temperantia, fortitudo certant cum iniquitate, luxuria, ignavia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tanta hominum perfidia et iniquitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89:section=207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89, § 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitates potestatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vespasiano ad obtinendas iniquitates haud perinde obstinante,</quote> <trans><tr>unreasonable demands in the shape of taxes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae iniquitatis se condemnari debere,</quote> <trans><tr>would render himself guilty of the highest injustice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si vobis non probabuntur, vestram iniquitatem accusatote,</quote> <trans><tr>your unreasonable demands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 208</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">unreasonable harshness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatem deum atque execrabilem fortunam suam incusabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 34, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab iniquitate judicis victoriam sperare,</quote> <trans><tr>partiality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:178" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 178</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris emendatae edicto Praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:25" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:41" default="NO">41</bibl>: calumniantium, <hi rend="ital">acts of injustice</hi>, Just. Inst. prooem. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
iniquo: <entryFree id="n23484" type="main" key="i^ni_quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render unfavorable</hi>: aequum animum alicui, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 126, 31</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 65 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
iniquus: <entryFree id="n23485" type="main" key="i^ni_quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-aequus</etym>, <sense id="n23485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unequal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23485.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23485.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis, inflicta vadis, dorso dum pendet iniquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga montis iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not of the right measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">too small</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haeret Hylas lateri (Herculis), passusque moratur iniquos,</quote> <trans><tr>greater than his own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:486" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquae heminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:130" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula iniqua,</quote> <trans><tr>too large</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquo pondere rastri,</quote> <trans><tr>too heavy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 164</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adhibitis iniquis ponderibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans><tr>too hot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <trans><tr>taken immoderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:66" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23485.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unfair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam iniqui sunt patres omnes in adulescentes judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem vel iniquā condicione retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: quid hoc iniquius dici potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis iniquae Tam patiens urbis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventres modio castigare iniquo,</quote> <trans><tr>with short measure</tr>, <tr>scanty fare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeripere ... valde est iniquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23485.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inimical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquum esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines natura asperi atque omnibus iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo iniquissimo infestissimoque aliquem intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurius iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu iniquo spectare,</quote> <trans><tr>with an envious</tr>, <tr>spiteful look</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 313</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqui mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 167</bibl></cit> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulli nostri iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 57</bibl></cit>.— Also in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus iniquissimis meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. inimicus, and Zumpt, Gram. § 410.—</sense><sense id="n23485.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disadvantageous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco iniquo subeundum erat ad hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca ad transitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 38, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus gnara vincentibus, iniqua (i. e. invia) nesciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum iniquo suo tempore imperatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia cum patriae tum sibi capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 475</bibl></cit>: sortem <cb n="INIT" /> miserari iniquam, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 243</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locum iniquiorem progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquissimo nostris loco proelium committere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locum subire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n23485.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unwilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discontented</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquo animo pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquo animo ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquissimo animo mori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquae mentis asellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum aequo an iniquo animo mortem subieris jam nihil refert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes iniqui,</quote> <trans><tr>ungracious</tr>, <tr>unkind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 87</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23485.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unsuitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc paene iniquum est, comico choragio conari agere nos tragoediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Imperfect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improperly drawn up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:57" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnīquē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23485.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unequally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam inique comparatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam vidi iniquius concertationem comparatam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where the parties were more unequally matched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc prope iniquissime comparatum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23485.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Unfairly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi> (opp. jure): <cit><quote lang="la">occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulsi, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 33: locum immeritum causari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Unfitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi inique Castorem cum Domitio comparem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23485.15" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Not patiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid iniquissime ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
initalia: <entryFree id="n23486" type="hapax" key="i^ni^ta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [initium], <sense id="n23486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">initial ceremonies</hi>: initalia Cereris adiit (al. initialia and inter alia Cereris templum), Capit. Marc. Aur. 27.</sense></entryFree>
initialis: <entryFree id="n23487" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">initial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incipient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">original</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23487.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum origo initialis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 156, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculorum progenies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 259: controversiae status, Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Limit. p. 63" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Limit. p. 63</bibl> Goes.— </sense><sense id="n23487.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭāles</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">those who first assembled together in</hi> a collegium, Inscr. ap. Marin. Iscriz. Alb. p. 12.</sense></entryFree>
initiamenta: <entryFree id="n23488" type="hapax" key="i^ni^ti^a_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [inito], <sense id="n23488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an initiation</hi> into secret rites; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
initiatio: <entryFree id="n23489" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a participation</hi> in secret religious rites: <cit><quote lang="la">Eleusiniorum sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
initiator: <entryFree id="n23490" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">novi testamenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
initiatrix: <entryFree id="n23491" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>initiator</etym>, <sense id="n23491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who originates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foundress</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteraturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum omnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> de Avarit. 4</bibl></cit> post med. p. 165 Rittersh.</sense></entryFree>
initio: <entryFree id="n23492" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>initium</etym>. <sense id="n23492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi> (only late Lat.): ver tunc initiatur, Firm. 2, 12: brassicam seremus vel irriguo loco, vel pluviā initiante madefacto, <hi rend="ital">when the rainy season begins</hi> (which begins again after the dog-days), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his initiata sunt cetera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initiatum jurgium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 6, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To initiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">admit</hi> to secret religious rites. </sense><sense id="n23492.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the sacred mysteries of Ceres: <cit><quote lang="la">initienturque eo ritu Cereri, quo Romae initiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7</bibl>.—Of other mysteries: <cit><quote lang="la">initiari Bacchis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 14, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicis cernis aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 108, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23492.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to initiate into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate to</hi> any thing (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim est sanctius sacris iisdem quam studiis initiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:20" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23492.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To baptize</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 8</bibl>, de Joh. Bapt.</sense></entryFree>
initium: <entryFree id="n23493" type="main" key="i^ni^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ineo</etym>, <sense id="n23493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">en trance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23493.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi> (syn.: principium, exordium). </sense><sense id="n23493.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis initiis orsus tribunatus, tristes exitus habuit consulatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initio accusationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initium capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi initium sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere initium confligendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis initium ab aliquo facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male ponere initia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere ab aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab initio res quem ad modum facta sint, exponemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: ab ultimo initio <pb n="956" /> <cb n="INJE" /> repetere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem ab altiore initio repetam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia initio caedis orto difficilis modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>.— Pleon.: querellae ab initio tantae ordiendae rei absint, Liv. praef. § 12; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prima initia incohare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum initium certaminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 10</bibl></cit>. — The <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> is used adverbially, <hi rend="ital">in the beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at first</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum senatus initio censuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeo ad illud quod initio scripsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tim. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alc. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:17 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 17 al.</bibl>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 475. — </sense><sense id="n23493.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23493.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Constituent parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elements</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde est indagatio nata initiorum, et tamquam seminum, unde essent omnia orta, generata, concreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: illa initia, et, ut e Graeco vertam, elementa dicuntur ( = <foreign lang="greek">stoixei=a</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of death: Augustus in sua resolutus initia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23493.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">First principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elements</hi> cf a science: <cit><quote lang="la">illa initia mathematicorum, quibus non concessis digitum progredi non possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23493.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo initium nobis rerum omnium ortus noster adferat, sic exitum mors, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus obscurissimis initiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:761" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 761</bibl></cit>; cf.: pauca ab initio causisque talium facinorum non absurda, <hi rend="ital">which relate to the origin</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23493.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Auspices</hi>, because with them everything was begun; hence, <hi rend="ital">the beginning of a reign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis initiis et ominibus opus est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a new king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23493.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Secret sacred rites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred mysteries</hi>, to which only the initiated were admitted: <cit><quote lang="la">initia vocantur potissimum ea, quae Cereri fiunt sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia Cereris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">39, 8, 5: nihil melius illis mysteriis, quibus ex agresti immanique vita exculti ad humanitatem et mitigati sumus, initiaque ut appellantur, ita re vera principia vitae cognovimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia Samothracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initiis pacis, foedus cum feritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23493.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Things</hi> (<hi rend="ital">musical instruments</hi>) <hi rend="ital">used in celebrating these mysteries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Typanum, tubam, Cybele, tua, mater, initia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inito: <entryFree id="n23494" type="hapax" key="i^ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n23494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [ineo], <hi rend="ital">to go into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>: loca horrida initas, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 336</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 1 Rib.); cf. inito, <foreign lang="greek">e)mbateu/w,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
initus: <entryFree id="n23495" type="main" key="i^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ineo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23496" type="main" key="i^ni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ineo</etym>, <sense id="n23496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23496.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23496.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres te, diva, tuumque Significant initum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23496.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commencement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">movendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 269</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23496.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (in mal. part.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues initum matutinum appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injectio: <entryFree id="n23497" type="main" key="injecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inicio</etym>. <sense id="n23497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing in;</hi> lit., med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an injection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clyster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:69" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:1:10" default="NO">5, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:17:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 17, 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23497.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A laying on</hi>: manus, <hi rend="ital">a laying on of the hand</hi>, an act by which one takes possession of a thing belonging to him without a judicial decision: <cit><quote lang="la">patri in filium, patrono in libertum manus injectio sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: aeris confessi debitique jure judicatis triginta dies justi sunto; post deinde manus injectio esto, Lex XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:10 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 10 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n23497.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat enim vera secum bona, in quae non est manus injectio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>such as cannot be grasped by the hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23497.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n23497.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An instigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satanae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pudic. 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23497.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An objection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Hermog. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
injectionale: <entryFree id="n23498" type="main" key="injecti^o_na_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injectĭōnāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>injectio</etym> (lit., <sense id="n23498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> of injectionalis, e, sc. remedium), <hi rend="ital">a clyster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
injectivus: <entryFree id="n23499" type="main" key="injecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inicio</etym>: injectivus status est generalis. Nam sive de possessione, sive de fine controversia nascatur, per hoc repetitio justa injustaque inicitur, Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Limit. Agr. p. 63" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Limit. Agr. p. 63</bibl> Goes.</entryFree>
injecto: <entryFree id="n23500" type="main" key="injecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:133" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:183" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 611</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
injectus: <entryFree id="n23501" type="main" key="injectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23502" type="main" key="injectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inicio</etym>, <sense id="n23502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casting on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprimere senem injectu multae vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>; <cb n="INJU" /> so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 17, 21, § 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23502.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a putting in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi in corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 740</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injexit: <entryFree id="n23503" type="main" key="injexit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injexit</orth> for <orth extent="full" lang="la">injēcĕrit</orth>, v. inicio <sense id="n23503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injicio: <entryFree id="n23504" type="main" key="inji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injĭcĭo</orth>, v. inicio.</entryFree>
injucunde: <entryFree id="n23505" type="main" key="inju_cunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. injucundus <sense id="n23505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injucunditas: <entryFree id="n23506" type="hapax" key="inju_cundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūcundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>injucundus</etym>, <sense id="n23506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpleasantness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid habeat injucunditatis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injucundus: <entryFree id="n23507" type="main" key="inju_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23507.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unpleasant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">minime nobis injucundus labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 36, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">schemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non injucundus auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 124</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:123" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23507.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus malos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">injūcundē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res injucundius actae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injudicatus: <entryFree id="n23508" type="main" key="inju_di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-judico</etym>. <sense id="n23508.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unsentenced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not formally tried by a judge</hi>: decem hominibus vitam eripis, indicta causa, injudicatis, incondemnatis, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23508.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Undecided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id injudicatum relinquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injugatus: <entryFree id="n23509" type="main" key="inju^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jŭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-jugo</etym>, <sense id="n23509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not yoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyoked</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injugis: <entryFree id="n23510" type="main" key="inju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jŭgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not yoked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has borne no yoke.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23510.1" n="I" level="1"> Hostia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: boves, qui sub jugo non fuerint, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 560, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23510.2" n="II" level="1"> Injuges versus, <hi rend="ital">verses in which no connecting particle occurs</hi> (e. g. tectum augustum, ingens, centum sublime columnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 170</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
injunctio: <entryFree id="n23511" type="main" key="injuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>injungo</etym>, <sense id="n23511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an injunction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
injunctus: <entryFree id="n23512" type="main" key="injunctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from injungo.</entryFree>
