<entryFree id="n23513" type="main" key="injunctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-junctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-jungo</etym>, <sense id="n23513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not joined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not united</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fideles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Ux. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injungo: <entryFree id="n23514" type="main" key="injungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join into</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n23514.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23514.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignos in asseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: arborem scrobi, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant into</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 10, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without scrobi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23514.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To join with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas et aggerem muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area injuncta domui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <trans><tr>to hang on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: nutrienda sarmenta putator injungit, <hi rend="ital">fastens on</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">does not cut off</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">injungere marem feminae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23514.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23514.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To inflict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring upon</hi> (syn. impono): <cit><quote lang="la">civitatibus aeternam servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui novum laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam a nobis repulsam aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 25</bibl></cit>: sibi tormentum, <hi rend="ital">to torment one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 86, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23514.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi> as a burden; <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoin</hi> (syn. mando): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui munus comitiorum habendorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuncta imperii munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuncta militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid a te jucundius mihi potuit injungi, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:94:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 94, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Bassus injunxerat ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injungo mihi ut,</quote> <trans><tr>I have determined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui superlationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, n. 12: nec sibi ullius rei moram necessitatemque injungebat, quin, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">permitted nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">however pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, etc., Auct. B. Alex. 44, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandi religionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to impose the obligation of an oath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:181" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injuratus: <entryFree id="n23515" type="main" key="inju_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsworn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having taken no oath</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">injuro): injurato scio plus credet mihi quam jurato tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 281</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id jurati dicunt quod ego injuratus insimulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. jurati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter jurati injuratique fugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41, 10</bibl></cit>: mens, Cic. poët. Off. 3, 29, 108.</sense></entryFree>
injurecessio: <entryFree id="n23516" type="main" key="inju_recessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūre-cessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (better separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">in jure cessio</orth>), <sense id="n23516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a form of delivering possession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a transfer of property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod valet mancipatio, idem valet et in jure cessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:22" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 22</bibl></cit> sqq.; v. jus, cessio. <cb n="INJU" /></sense></entryFree>
injuria: <entryFree id="n23517" type="main" key="inju_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>injurius</etym>, <sense id="n23517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any thing that is done contrary to justice and equity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria ex eo dicta est, quod non jure fiat! omne enim, quod non jure fit, injuria fieri dicitur: hoc generaliter. Specialiter autem injuria dicitur contumelia. Interdum injuriae appellatione damnum culpa datum significatur: interdum iniquitatem injuriam dicimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum autem duobis modis, id est aut vi aut fraude, fiat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae sunt, quae aut pulsatione corpus, aut convicio aures, aut aliqua turpitudine vitam cujuspiam violant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 35</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n23517.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi a me nulla orta est injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum est a sapiente non modo injuriam cui facere, verum etiam nocere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias contumeliasque imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam jacere et immittere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:section=28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in populum Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:18:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 18, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condonare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis onerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per injuriam,</quote> <trans><tr>in an unjust manner</tr>, <tr>unjustly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 226</bibl></cit>.—The <case>abl.</case> injuriā is used adverb., <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undeservedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without cause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne palma detur cuiquam artifici injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispertivisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me meis civibus injuriā suspectum viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc horret Milo: nec injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n23517.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawful</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unjust conduct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23517.3" n="A" level="2"> </sense><sense id="n23517.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injustice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongdoing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vostrā hercle factum injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque aspexisti, ut furiae, sic tuae tibi occurrunt injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meum jus teneam et injuriam tuam persequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 11, 32</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23517.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro veteribus Helvetiorum injuriis populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinae mulieres, quarum ex injuria bellum ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; cf., so of <hi rend="ital">dishonoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deflowering</hi> a virgin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23517.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An injurious act</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outrage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affront</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum multam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum dicam alicui scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: actio injuriarum, <hi rend="ital">an action for a personal injury</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affront</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum injuriae muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47</bibl></cit>, tit. 10: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11</bibl></cit>: injuriarum experiri, ib. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum judicio convenire quempiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantine injuria cenae?</quote> <trans><tr>the insult of a dinner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23517.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unjust severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(filius) carens patriā ob meas injurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">paterna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23517.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Revenge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">punishment for injury inflicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria consulis, etiam si justa, non tamen in magistratu exercenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria caedis nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 256</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23517.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An unjust acquisition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23517.10" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi> of any kind, even that which proceeds from inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">ab injuria oblivionis aliquem asserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigorum, grandinum aut nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 24, 47, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam vinculis onerat, ex quorum injuria decessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparere incolumem ac sine injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerens injuria lumbis,</quote> <trans><tr>pain</tr>, <tr>disease</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 38, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curandum ne magna injuria fiat fortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injurie: <entryFree id="n23518" type="main" key="inju_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. injurius <sense id="n23518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injurior: <entryFree id="n23519" type="main" key="inju_ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>injuria</etym>, <sense id="n23519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to do an injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to injure</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omne fortuitum citra nos saevit atque injuriatur (a dub. reading),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus victoriatum est, quam injuriatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 6</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 31, 1</bibl></cit> Fickert (al. in injuriam): <cit><quote lang="la">elephas injuriatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injuriose: <entryFree id="n23520" type="main" key="inju_ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. injuriosus <sense id="n23520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injuriosus: <entryFree id="n23521" type="main" key="inju_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>injuria</etym>, <sense id="n23521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acting unjustly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriosi in proximos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriosa et facinorosa vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appetitio alienorum (avaritia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus patrem injuriosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: genus hominum injuriosissimum, Hadrian. Imp. Ep. <pb n="957" /> <cb n="INJU" /> ap. Vopisc. Saturn. 8.—</sense><sense id="n23521.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noxious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurioso ictu vitem verberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in magistratibus injuriose decreverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra conjugalia tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:32" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 10, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatoribus injuriosius tractatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aliquem injuriosissime cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Quaest. 83" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Quaest. 83</bibl></cit>, n. 82.</sense></entryFree>
injurius: <entryFree id="n23522" type="main" key="inju_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-jus</etym>, <sense id="n23522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that acts unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi> (mostly ante-class.): <hi rend="ital">Scel.</hi> Quis igitur vocare? <hi rend="ital">Phil.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">*dikai/a|</foreign> nomen est. <hi rend="ital">Scel.</hi> Injuria's, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria's qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id succenseat, ipsus sibi esse injurius videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me illi irasci injurium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 14</bibl> and 15; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia sit injurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicta causa damnari absentem consularem virum injurium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">injūrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlawfully</hi>: injurie facere, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 124, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 40 Rib.): injurie dictum pro injuriose, Non. ib.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem injuriissime nominare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 67</bibl></cit> dub. (others read irrisive).</sense></entryFree>
injuro: <entryFree id="n23523" type="main" key="inju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. in-juro</etym>, <sense id="n23523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to swear</hi> (very rare; cf. injuratus): qui injuraverit, Inscr. ap. Mar. Fratr. Arv. p. 70.</sense></entryFree>
injurus: <entryFree id="n23524" type="main" key="inju_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-jus</etym>, <sense id="n23524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that acts unlawfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impure, inhoneste, injure, illex, labes popli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: injurum, perjurum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=110" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 110</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
injussus: <entryFree id="n23525" type="main" key="injussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-jubeo</etym>, <sense id="n23525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voluntary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own accord.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23525.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut numquam inducant animum cantare rogati, injussi numquam desistant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injussae veniunt ad mulctra capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23525.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: injussaque tela vagantur, <hi rend="ital">that fly from the soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">hands against their will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injussa virescunt Gramina,</quote> <trans><tr>spontaneous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23526" type="main" key="injussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-jussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, only in the <case>abl.</case>, <sense id="n23526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without command</hi> (freq. in Cic. and Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus, injussu suo, nullo pacto potest religione obligari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injussu imperatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 63, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 32, 11</bibl>; 5, 19, 9 al.</sense></entryFree>
injuste: <entryFree id="n23527" type="main" key="injuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. injustus <sense id="n23527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
injustitia: <entryFree id="n23528" type="main" key="injusti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">injustĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>injustus</etym>. <sense id="n23528.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Injustice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust proceeding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustitiae duo genera sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius injustitiae nulla capitalior est, quam eorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 42</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprobrante illis peccata et injustitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 16, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23528.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh proceeding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ego hinc ejeci injustitiā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
injustus: <entryFree id="n23529" type="main" key="injustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-justus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is contrary to right and justice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23529.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">onus ( = immodicum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustis collatum viribus hostem,</quote> <trans><tr>unequal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:774" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 774</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23529.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">unjust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir maleficus naturā et injustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverca,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>severe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homine imperito numquam quidquam injustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emori, ne aliquid faciat injustum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites Sidicinis injusta arma cum intulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injusto carpere dente,</quote> <trans><tr>with envious</tr>, <tr>malicious tooth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quam injustum in patriam ... esset, non videbat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustissima atque acerbissima incommoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustaque regna tenebat,</quote> <trans><tr>unjustly gotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 277</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">injustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">injustice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura inventa metu injusti fateare necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 111</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">injustē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23529.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., i. q. injuriā, <hi rend="ital">wrongfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfairly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus non injuste terret,</quote> <trans><tr>not without cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23529.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">unjustly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperare alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: in aliquem dicere,<cb n="INNA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facis injuste si putas, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21, 84 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male et injuste facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injustissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inlaqueatus: <entryFree id="n23530" type="main" key="inla^que^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-lăquĕātus</orth>, v. illaqueatus.</entryFree>
inlargio: <entryFree id="n23531" type="main" key="inlargi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-largĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bestow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>: pecuniam inlargibo tibi, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inlex: <entryFree id="n23532" type="main" key="inlex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inlex</orth>, v. illex.</entryFree>
inlicitator: <entryFree id="n23533" type="gloss" key="inli^ci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-lĭcĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchaser</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=113:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 113, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inlicium: <entryFree id="n23534" type="main" key="inli^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inlĭcĭum</orth>, v. illicium.</entryFree>
inlitteratus: <entryFree id="n23535" type="main" key="inlitte^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inlittĕrātus</orth>, v. illitteratus.</entryFree>
inludia: <entryFree id="n23536" type="main" key="inlu_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inlūdĭa</orth>, v. illudia.</entryFree>
inlutus: <entryFree id="n23537" type="main" key="inlu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inlūtus</orth>, v. illotus.</entryFree>
innabilis: <entryFree id="n23538" type="hapax" key="inna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-no</etym>, <sense id="n23538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be swum in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innarrabilis: <entryFree id="n23539" type="main" key="innarra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-narrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indescribable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">soni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Carm. de Phoenic. 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">narrabilis, innarrabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innascibilis: <entryFree id="n23540" type="main" key="innasci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nascĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be born</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescript. adv. Haer. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innascor: <entryFree id="n23541" type="main" key="innascor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nascor</orth>, <itype>nātus sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be born in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spring up in</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n23541.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglectis urenda filix innascitur agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fauni velut innati triviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innata rupibus altis robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem innati solo, quod incolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innata in cornibus cervi hedera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvitium uni tantum animalium homini, praeterquam innatum,</quote> <trans><tr>excepting those that have it naturally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23541.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.), <hi rend="ital">to arise in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be produced in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac elatione animi nimia cupiditas principatus innascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">inborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inherent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23541.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: non mihi avaritia umquam innatast; <cit><quote lang="la">satis habeo divitiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innatam esse homini probitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt ingeniis nostris semina innata virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quaedam alacritas naturaliter innata omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectata aliis castitas, tibi ingenita et innata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23541.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus est igitur innatus in nobis cognitionis amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animis eorum insitum atque innatum esse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23541.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos habere insitam quandam, vel potius innatam cupiditatem scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innata atque insita anteponantur assumptis atque adventiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectatio innata videtur esse, non arcessita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innato: <entryFree id="n23542" type="main" key="inna^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-năto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n23542.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23542.2" n="A" level="2"> Homines flumini innatant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquis pluma innatans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 86, § 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca innatat acri Post vinum stomacho ( = supernatat, non subsidet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce (vinum) stomacho innatat, austerum facilius concoquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23542.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undam innatat alnus,</quote> <trans><tr>swims the stream</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 451</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23542.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pisciculi parvi in concham hiantem innataverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23542.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To flow over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overflow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus fecundus innatat terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">innatat campis (Tiberis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innatat unda freto dulcis,</quote> <trans><tr>the fresh water flows into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23542.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To swim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be intermingled with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter hos latent arteriae ... his innatant venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23542.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23542.8" n="A" level="2"> Innatans illa verborum facilitas, <hi rend="ital">floating on the surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:44" default="NO">7, 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23542.9" n="B" level="2"> Of the hair, <hi rend="ital">to float</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui vagus innatat undā Crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:525" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 525</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innaturalis: <entryFree id="n23543" type="main" key="inna_tu_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nātūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnatural</hi> (late Lat.): amplexus, Sarisb. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
innatus: <entryFree id="n23544" type="main" key="inna_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nascor</etym>, <sense id="n23544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not born</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unborn</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">innatus Deus annon et innata materia?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 245</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n23545" type="main" key="inna_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from in-nascor.</entryFree>
innavigabilis: <entryFree id="n23546" type="main" key="inna_vi^ga_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nāvĭgābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnavigable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 16, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innavigo: <entryFree id="n23547" type="main" key="inna_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistro latere innavigantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit> <cb n="INNO" /> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23547.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">V. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">navigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec innavigabitur mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. 25, p. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
innecto: <entryFree id="n23548" type="main" key="innecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-necto</orth>, <itype>nexŭi, nexum, 3</itype> (innectier for innecti, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 375</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fasten to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">about.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23548.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">paribus palmas amborum innexuit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla auro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora sertis,</quote> <trans><tr>to deck</tr>, <tr>garland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces laqueo,</quote> <trans><tr>to encircle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambos innectens manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia compedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: innecti cervicibus, <hi rend="ital">to fasten upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cling to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">embrace the neck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc placuit caesis innectere vincula silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 670</bibl></cit>; v. Orelli ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:72" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 72</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos et vincula rupit, Queis innexa pedem malo pendebat ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipereum crinem vittis innexa cruentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 281</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23548.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23548.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to connect one thing with another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adduce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">devise successively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas innecte morandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:743" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudem clienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 609</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23548.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23548.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innexus conscientiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23548.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyrcanis per affinitatem innexus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animi innexi implicatique vigoribus quibusdam mentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem, i. e. veneficio illigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 416" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 416</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innervis: <entryFree id="n23549" type="main" key="innervis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innervis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nervus</etym>, <sense id="n23549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enervated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">marcidus et innervis animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innexus: <entryFree id="n23550" type="main" key="innexus1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from innecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23551" type="spur" key="innexus2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, a false reading in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 115</bibl>, instead of in nexu.</entryFree>
innisus: <entryFree id="n23552" type="main" key="inni_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. innitor.</entryFree>
innitor: <entryFree id="n23553" type="main" key="inni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nītor</orth>, <itype>nixus or nīsus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rest upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to support one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self by</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n23553.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23553.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vineis breves ad innitendum cannas circumdare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 185</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n23553.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">innititur hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractae hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:144" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutis innixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa vastis innixa columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores radicibus innixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta innixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderamine navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 726</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23553.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Pansam fratrem innixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 182</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23553.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lean upon</hi> in order to press down, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantus lixam genu innixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 84" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23553.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23553.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipuus, cui secreta imperatorum inniterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem suam incolumitati Pisonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia curae tutelaeque unius innixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis promissis freti et innixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23553.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>: syllabae nostrae in <hi rend="ital">b</hi> litteram et <hi rend="ital">d</hi> innituntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23553.9" n="C" level="2"> Innixum sidus, i. q. En gonasi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innixus: <entryFree id="n23554" type="main" key="innixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innixus</orth>, v. innitor <sense id="n23554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inno: <entryFree id="n23555" type="main" key="inno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-no</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">float in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23555.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23555.2" n="A" level="2"> Partim submersae, partim fluitantes et innantes beluae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innare contextis ratibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innabant pariter fluctusque secabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innare aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviis, Col. poët. 10, 388. — Of vessels, a fleet, etc.: quo levior classis vadoso mari innaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:448" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 448</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapaces fluvios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvium vinclis innaret Cloelia ruptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 651</bibl></cit>. — With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23555.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flow upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innantem Maricae littoribus Lirim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23555.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sail upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">navigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygios lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innobilitatus: <entryFree id="n23556" type="main" key="inno_bi^li^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nōbĭlĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nobilito</etym>, <sense id="n23556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not ennobled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignoble</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innocens: <entryFree id="n23557" type="main" key="inno^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŏcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n23557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> innocentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but innocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 4, 52, § 116</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">that does no harm.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23557.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">harmless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inoffensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innoxious</hi> (syn. insons): <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:83:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 83, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentis pocula Lesbii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentior cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23557.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that harms no one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guiltless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23557.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: servus, Plant. Capt. 3, 5, 7: <pb n="958" /> <cb n="INNO" /> innocens is dicitur, non qui leviter nocet, sed qui nihil nocet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocens si accusatus sit, absolvi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir integer, innocens, religiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:4:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factorum innocens sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentissimo patre privatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:33:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 33, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones,</quote> <trans><tr>carried on without bitterness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita innocentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the guiltless man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum innocente abstinentiā certabat (Cato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 54, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23557.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">disinterested</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir innocens et industrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:28:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 28, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏcenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">harmlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blamelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes innocenter paratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae caeduntur, innocentius decrescente luna, quam crescente fiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>more safely</tr>, <tr>better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: vita innocentissime acta, Auct. Decl. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innocentia: <entryFree id="n23558" type="main" key="inno^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŏcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harmlessness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23558.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferorum animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 77, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumi graveolentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23558.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23558.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">blamelessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est innocentia affectio talis animi, quae noceat nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigidae innocentiae Cato erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola innocentia vivere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with no other support</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuā innocentiā tutum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>where no one seeks to injure another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23558.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disinterestedness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantā innocentiā debent esse imperatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam innocentiam (opp. avaritiam) perpetuā vitā esse perspectam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B, G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23558.5" n="C" level="2"> Collect. concr., <hi rend="ital">innocent persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentiam liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innocia: <entryFree id="n23559" type="gloss" key="inno^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">innocence</hi>, Gloss. Phil.</sense></entryFree>
innocue: <entryFree id="n23560" type="main" key="inno^cu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏcŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. innocuus <sense id="n23560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
innocuus: <entryFree id="n23561" type="main" key="inno^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŏcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harmless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocuous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n23561.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23561.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luporum genus innocuum homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber leguminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:800" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 800</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <trans><tr>safe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23561.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere carinae omnes innocuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fida per innocuas errent incendia turres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 330</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23561.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inoffensive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viximus innocuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere causas innocuas,</quote> <trans><tr>to defend the innocent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:273" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocuum perforat ense latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 26</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏcŭē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23561.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Harmlessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas tanta arte direxit, ut omnes per intervalla digitorum innocue evaderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23561.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Innocently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 640</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innodo: <entryFree id="n23562" type="main" key="inno_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nōdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fasten with a knot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23562.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">innodato gutture laquei nexibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altis cervicibus cito laqueus innodatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 8, § 44.—</sense><sense id="n23562.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiris categoricis lubricas quaestiones innodare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa non multis ambagibus innodata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 31, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innominabilis: <entryFree id="n23563" type="main" key="inno_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innōmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nomino</etym>, <sense id="n23563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nameless</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">indictus, innominabilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 37</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
innominatus: <entryFree id="n23564" type="main" key="inno_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nōmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnamed</hi>, Sarisb. 2, 27; Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innotescentia: <entryFree id="n23565" type="main" key="inno_tescenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innōtescentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>innotesco</etym>, <sense id="n23565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming known</hi>, Sarisb. in Ep.</sense></entryFree>
innotesco: <entryFree id="n23566" type="main" key="inno_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nōtesco</orth>, <itype>tui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23566.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To become known</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23566.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris innotuit illa libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petulanti pictura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n23566.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi innotuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina quae vulgo innotuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23566.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of daylight, <hi rend="ital">to become clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innotescente jam luce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23566.5" n="II" level="1"> (I. q. cognosco.) <hi rend="ital">To come to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to learn by experience</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:5:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 5, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innoto: <entryFree id="n23567" type="hapax" key="inno^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take notice of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 4, 1</bibl> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">chrismate innotatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innovatio: <entryFree id="n23568" type="main" key="inno^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>innovo</etym>, <sense id="n23568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an alteration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innovation</hi> (late Lat.; syn.: instauratio, renovatio), Tert. adv. <cb n="INNU" /> Marc. 1, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innovo: <entryFree id="n23569" type="main" key="inno^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŏvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23569.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima innovare instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—So in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innŏ-vātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">renewed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n23569.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: se ad aliquam rem, <hi rend="ital">to return to a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad suam intemperantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>.—As a translation of <foreign lang="greek">kainiei=,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:38:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 38, 30</bibl>: vox mallei innovat aurem, <hi rend="ital">the noise of the hammer is ever in his ears.</hi></sense></entryFree>
innox: <entryFree id="n23570" type="gloss" key="innox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innox</orth>, <sense id="n23570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harmless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 125</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Rein. cl. 20, n. 144, 145, and 317.</sense></entryFree>
innoxie: <entryFree id="n23571" type="main" key="innoxi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innoxĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. innoxius <sense id="n23571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
