innoxius: <entryFree id="n23572" type="main" key="innoxi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-noxĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harmless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innoxious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23572.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23572.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam animalia indigenis innoxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 59, 84, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis viribus (bibentium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>not mortal</tr>, <tr>curable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 52, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <trans><tr>free from noxious animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc vel illinc appellere indiscretum et innoxium est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 47</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n23572.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That does harm to none</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not guilty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blameless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet innocentem servum atque innoxium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum innoxia dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 628</bibl></cit>: animus innoxior (al. innoxiior), Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 601</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas,</quote> <trans><tr>undeserved poverty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23572.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis innoxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initi consilii in caput regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23572.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut innoxium abs te atque abs tuis me inrideas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who never harmed you or yours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23572.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innoxius volvitur in flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi magistratus, provincias aliaque omnia tenere, ipsi innoxii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 39:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 40</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacras innoxia laurus vescar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23572.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">prep. a</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens a saevo serpentum innoxia morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 892</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba a curculionibus innoxia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-noxĭē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23572.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Harmlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without harm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emollire alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23572.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Blamelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innubilo: <entryFree id="n23573" type="main" key="innu_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūbĭlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cloud over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overcast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make gloomy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23573.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53, 24</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23573.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitatem gaudii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 238" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innubilus: <entryFree id="n23574" type="hapax" key="innu_bi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūbĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclouded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloudless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innubis: <entryFree id="n23575" type="hapax" key="innu_bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innūbis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nubes</etym>, <sense id="n23575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloudless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 238" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innubo: <entryFree id="n23576" type="main" key="innu_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūbo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to marry into.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae haud facile iis, in quibus nata erat, humiliora sineret ea, quae innupsisset,</quote> <trans><tr>into which she had married</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris thalamis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 856</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23576.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innubus: <entryFree id="n23577" type="main" key="innu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n23577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmarried.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23577.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 567</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:87" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 605</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23577.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the laurel (because Daphne, who was never married, was changed into it): <cit><quote lang="la">innuba laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innucleatus: <entryFree id="n23578" type="hapax" key="innu_^cle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innū^clĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nucleo</etym>, <sense id="n23578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not stoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which the kernels are not taken out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae passae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innumerabilis: <entryFree id="n23579" type="main" key="innu^me^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭmĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">countless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innumerable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atomi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">series annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiam multos vel innumerabiles potius quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 30</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:45" default="NO">12, 1, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innŭmĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">innumerably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
innumerabilitas: <entryFree id="n23580" type="main" key="innu^me^ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŭmĕrābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>innumerabilis</etym>, <sense id="n23580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">countless number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innumerableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atomorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 132</bibl> Herald.</sense></entryFree>
innumerabiliter: <entryFree id="n23581" type="main" key="innu^me^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innŭmĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. innumerabilis <sense id="n23581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
innumeralis: <entryFree id="n23582" type="hapax" key="innu^me^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭmĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">numberless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innumerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1086" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1086</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innumeratus: <entryFree id="n23583" type="main" key="innu^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭmĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-numero</etym>, <sense id="n23583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnumbered</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">miracula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. Carm. 2, 17</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INOB" /></sense></entryFree>
innumerosus: <entryFree id="n23584" type="main" key="innu^me^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭmĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">countless</hi> (late Lat.): manus, Coripp. Joann. 5, 662: domini, Hilar. in Psa. 122, 6.</sense></entryFree>
innumerus: <entryFree id="n23585" type="main" key="innu^me^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭmĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">countless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innumerable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numberless.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23585.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">false reading instead of meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Orell. and Klotz): numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1054" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1054</bibl></cit>: scaena est deserta, dein Risus, Ludu' jocusque, et numeri innumeri simul omnes collacrumarunt, <hi rend="ital">verses without number</hi>, Plaut. or Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumeras adversariorum copias superare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post proelii innumeras caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes populique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 706</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 204</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 366</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:55:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 55, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo populorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23585.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">without metre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosaic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumeros numeros doctis accentibus effer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innuo: <entryFree id="n23586" type="main" key="innu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a nod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to nod to; to give a sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hint.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23586.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ego innuero vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abiens innuit mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat innuebat digito similis vocanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23586.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mora sit, si innuerim, quin pugnus in mala haereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi innuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram licet innuat atque Rescribat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua innuetur his signis esse tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n23586.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, = significo, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
innuptus: <entryFree id="n23587" type="main" key="innuptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nuptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n23587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmarried.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23587.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23587.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri innuptaeque puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <trans><tr>virginal</tr>, <tr>virgin-</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:75" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23587.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">innupta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an unmarried woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a virgin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes">12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes">36</bibl>; 64, 78; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegnans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Luc. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23587.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: innuptae nuptiae (<foreign lang="greek">ga/mos a)/gamos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a marriage that is no marriage, an unhappy marriage</hi>, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 219</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. Inc. v. 80 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
innutribilis: <entryFree id="n23588" type="main" key="innu_tri_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūtrībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not nourishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juscellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:55" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innutrio: <entryFree id="n23589" type="main" key="innu_tri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūtrĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to nourish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring up in</hi> any thing (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne castris innutriretur et armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:286" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 286</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigenae atque ipsius provinciae finibus innutriti, Cod. Th. 7, 13, 6, § 1: mari innutritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplis opibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicis laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:16:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestium praeceptorum disciplinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalibus disciplinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certis ingeniis innutriri oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
innutritus: <entryFree id="n23590" type="main" key="innu_tri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">innūtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from innutrio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23591" type="main" key="innu_tri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-nūtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-nutrio</etym>, <sense id="n23591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not nourished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without nourishment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 17:1:17:section=177" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 17, 1, 17, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ino: <entryFree id="n23592" type="main" key="i_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">īnō</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ino</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 2</bibl>), <sense id="n23592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Cadmus and Harmonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Semele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Athamas king of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nurse of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Learchus and Melicerta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and step-mother of Phrixus and Helle. Being pursued by Athamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had become raving mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she threw herself with Melicerta into the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whereupon they were both changed into sea-deities. Ino</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was called</hi> Matuta (Gr. Leucothea), <hi rend="ital">and Melicerta</hi> Palaemon or Portumnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:416 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 416 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:485" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 485</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:123 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 123 al.</bibl>; cf. Preller's Gr. Mythol. 1, p. 377 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n23592.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnōŭs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ino</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Melicerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 437</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Palaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 823</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <trans><tr>where Ino wished to sacrifice Phrixus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:521" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>where Ino threw herself into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 2:608" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmus,</quote> <trans><tr>where games were celebrated by Athamas in honor of Ino</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lechaeum,</quote> <trans><tr>a promontory of the isthmus just mentioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobaudientia: <entryFree id="n23593" type="main" key="i^no^baudi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏbaudĭentĭa</orth>, v. inoboedientia <sense id="n23593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inobaudio: <entryFree id="n23594" type="main" key="i^no^baudi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏbaudĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. inoboedio.</entryFree>
inobediens: <entryFree id="n23595" type="main" key="i^no^be_di^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏbēdĭens</orth>, etc., v. inoboediens, etc.</entryFree>
inobjurgatus: <entryFree id="n23596" type="main" key="i^nobjurga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-objurgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not scolded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not blamed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 41</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inoblector: <entryFree id="n23597" type="main" key="i^noblector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-oblector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take delight in</hi> any thing (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in filiis hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Hermog. 18</bibl></cit>. <pb n="959" /> <cb n="INOD" /></sense></entryFree>
inobliteratus: <entryFree id="n23598" type="main" key="i^nobli_te^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-oblītĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not obliterated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unforgotten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inoblitus: <entryFree id="n23599" type="main" key="i^nobli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-oblītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not forgetful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mindful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inoboediens: <entryFree id="n23600" type="main" key="i^no^boedi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏboedĭens</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏboedĭenter</orth>, v. inoboedio <sense id="n23600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inoboedientia: <entryFree id="n23601" type="main" key="i^no^boedi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏboedĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disobedience</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Quaest. Hebr. ad Reg. 2, 1</bibl>.—In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏbaudĭentĭa</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
inoboedio: <entryFree id="n23602" type="main" key="i^no^boedi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏboedĭo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏbaudĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disobey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be disobedient</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. Epiph. 1</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏboedĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">disobedient</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Interp. Deut. 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Tit. 1, 10</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏboedĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">disobediently</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 17.</sense></entryFree>
inoboedus: <entryFree id="n23603" type="main" key="i^no^boedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏboedus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inoboedio</etym>, <sense id="n23603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disobedient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessatio (al. in obeundo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 248</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobrutus: <entryFree id="n23604" type="hapax" key="i^nobru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obrŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not overwhelmed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 356</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inobsaeptus: <entryFree id="n23605" type="main" key="i^nobsaeptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obsaeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-obsaepio</etym>, <sense id="n23605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hedged up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not closed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina aurium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobscurabilis: <entryFree id="n23606" type="main" key="i^nobscu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obscūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be obscured</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">regula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobscuro: <entryFree id="n23607" type="spur" key="i^nobscu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obscūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 10</bibl>, instead of obscurabit.</entryFree>
inobsequens: <entryFree id="n23608" type="main" key="i^nobse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obsĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not yielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncomplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disobedient</hi>, Sen. praef. Q. N. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi frenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 1068</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumaces et inobsequentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inobsequentia: <entryFree id="n23609" type="main" key="i^nobse^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obsĕquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disobedience</hi>, Jul. Valer. Res Gest. Alex. M. 2, 21 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
inobservabilis: <entryFree id="n23610" type="main" key="i^nobserva_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-observābĭlis</orth>, e. <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be observed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unobservable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobservans: <entryFree id="n23611" type="main" key="i^nobservans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-observans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unobservant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobservantia: <entryFree id="n23612" type="main" key="i^nobservanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnobservantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inobservans</etym>, <sense id="n23612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inattention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregularity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ne fecisse inobservantia quadam videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:107" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inobservatus: <entryFree id="n23613" type="main" key="i^nobserva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-observātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unobserved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unperceived</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 544</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 341</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et incertum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:111" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:32:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 32, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inobsoletus: <entryFree id="n23614" type="main" key="i^nobso^le_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-obsŏlētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not grown old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inocciduus: <entryFree id="n23615" type="main" key="i^nocci^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-occĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">never setting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23615.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans><tr>the north pole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 175</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23615.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <trans><tr>ever open eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:277" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>inextinguishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita continua et inoccidua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inocco: <entryFree id="n23616" type="main" key="i^nocco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-occo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to harrow in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen inoccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:82" default="NO">11, 2, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinatio inoccata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inoccultus: <entryFree id="n23617" type="main" key="i^noccultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-occultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not secret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl> dub. (al. incultus).</sense></entryFree>
inoculatio: <entryFree id="n23618" type="main" key="i^no^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inoculo</etym>, <sense id="n23618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inoculating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:54" default="NO">11, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 7, 5</bibl>. (An earlier method of inoculating is described in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 23, § 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 118</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
inoculator: <entryFree id="n23619" type="main" key="i^no^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inoculator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 329</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inoculo: <entryFree id="n23620" type="main" key="i^no^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inoculate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to ingraft an eye</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bud of one tree into another</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores ficorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:59" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23620.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To implant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae affectum pectoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23620.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To adorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bullis aureis inoculatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 185, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inodiatus: <entryFree id="n23621" type="main" key="i^no^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏdĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-odium</etym>, <sense id="n23621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosus, inodiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inodoro: <entryFree id="n23622" type="main" key="i^no^do_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏdōro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandentium halitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inodoror: <entryFree id="n23623" type="spur" key="i^no^do_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏdōror</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, formerly regarded as <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smell out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trace out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiliter inodoratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>, where Orell., B. and K., al. now read moratus.</sense></entryFree>
inodorus: <entryFree id="n23624" type="main" key="i^no^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23624.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inodorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <trans><tr>unperfumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23624.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without the sense of smell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 129, 11</bibl>). <cb n="INOP" /></sense></entryFree>
inoffense: <entryFree id="n23625" type="main" key="i^noffense_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnoffensē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inoffensus <sense id="n23625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inoffensus: <entryFree id="n23626" type="main" key="i^noffensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-offensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not struck; without stumbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unobstructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n23626.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogit inoffensae currus accedere metae,</quote> <trans><tr>untouched</tr>, <tr>not grazed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis regionisque abundantiam inoffensa transmitteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inoffensum pedem referre,</quote> <trans><tr>not stumbling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23626.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that goes on without hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without obstacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhindered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inoffensae metam tangere vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>placid</tr>, <tr>undisturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mare inoffensum crescenti adlabitur aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus honorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum inter se conjunctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copulatio vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā temperantiā (vir) ut omnia fere vitae suae tempora valetudine inoffensa vixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnoffensē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without stumbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without hinderance</hi>, Ambros. Apol. David, 3, § 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:in Psa. 118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 10, 43; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 35</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inoffensius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inofficiositas: <entryFree id="n23627" type="main" key="i^noffi^ci^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnoffĭcĭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inofficiosus</etym>, <sense id="n23627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disobligingness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Ep. 3</bibl>: Ruricius, Ep. 2, 15.</sense></entryFree>
inofficiosus: <entryFree id="n23628" type="main" key="i^noffi^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-offĭcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undutiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inofficious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23628.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n23628.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not observant of his duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undutiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana gens inofficiosa dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertus inofficiosus patrono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23628.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Contrary to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s duty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum, i. e. one in which nothing is left to one's nearest relatives, children, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:42:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 42, 107</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23628.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">not obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disobliging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inolens: <entryFree id="n23629" type="hapax" key="i^no^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inodorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 850</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inolesco: <entryFree id="n23630" type="main" key="i^no^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏlesco</orth>, <itype>lēvi, ŏlĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (inolesti, Aus. Grat. Act. § 36). </sense><sense id="n23630.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n23630.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">udo libro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est multa diu concreta modis inolescere miris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 738</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:583" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 583</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradux a materno sustinetur ubere dum inolescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23630.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua veterum scriptorum tractatione inoleverat linguae illius vox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had remained fixed in his mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nosti, meditando velis inolescere menti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23630.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to implant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura induit nobis inolevitque amorem nostri et caritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui semina amoris inolesti (= inolevisti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. ad Grat. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inolitum nomen urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:33" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 33</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">in moribus inolescendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inominalis: <entryFree id="n23631" type="main" key="i^no_mi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōmĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illomened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inauspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inominatus: <entryFree id="n23632" type="hapax" key="i^no_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ill-omened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inauspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:38" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inopaco: <entryFree id="n23633" type="main" key="i^no^pa_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpāco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overshadow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inopacus: <entryFree id="n23634" type="main" key="i^no^pa_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpācus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not shady</hi>: inopacus, <foreign lang="greek">a)/skios,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inoperatus: <entryFree id="n23635" type="main" key="i^no^pe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23635.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not wrought</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Fid. 3, 14, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inopero: <entryFree id="n23636" type="main" key="i^no^pe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc inoperatur per Deum Patrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Orig. de Principp. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inoperor: <entryFree id="n23637" type="main" key="i^no^pe^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpĕror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ille inoperatus est in Christum valentiam suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl></cit> (ex adv. Ephes. 1).</sense></entryFree>
inopertus: <entryFree id="n23638" type="main" key="i^no^pertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23638.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite inoperto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23638.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">naked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac confessa veritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inopia: <entryFree id="n23639" type="main" key="i^no^pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inops</etym>, <sense id="n23639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23639.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti commeatusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et amore pereo et inopia argentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advocatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 35 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23639.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a want</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of necessaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">need</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fewness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23639.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: opem ferre inopiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to one in want</hi>, <cb n="INOP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 3</bibl>: Quor (me) conducebas? <hi rend="ital">Bal.</hi> Inopia; <cit><quote lang="la">alius non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inopiam cives objectare possint tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si propter inopiam in egestate estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum propter imbecillitatem atque inopiam desiderata sit amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam ex inopia atque egestate natam volunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also with egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Rhodiorum inopia et fame summaque annonae caritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiae subsidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam vitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pudendam inopiam delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam alicui facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring one to want</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manuum mercede inopiam tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum dierum inopia contrahere pestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispensatio inopiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of scanty supplies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23639.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23639.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Want</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helplessness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio esse contra vim et gratiam solitudini atque inopiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to those who have no protectors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac causa improbitatem et gratiam cum inopia et veritate contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 20, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <trans><tr>worthlessness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti cum difficultate itinerum locorumque inopia,</quote> <trans><tr>and the want of necessaries in these regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:54:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23639.6" n="2" level="3"> Of a speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">inopia et jejunitas,</quote> <trans><tr>poverty of ideas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23639.7" n="3" level="3"> Of the <hi rend="ital">want of fruition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendere animum cupidum alicujus inopiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inopinabilis: <entryFree id="n23640" type="main" key="i^no^pi_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpīnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be supposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconceivable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (dictum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23640.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">surprising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paradoxical</hi>: infames materias, sive quis mavult dicere inopinabiles, quas Graeci <foreign lang="greek">a)do/cous u(poqe/seis</foreign> appellant, veteres adorti sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inŏpīnābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inopinans: <entryFree id="n23641" type="main" key="i^no^pi_nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpīnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not expecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaware</hi> (freq. in the historians; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): inscios inopinantesque Menapios oppresserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impeditos et inopinantes aggressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imprudente atque inopinante Curione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex in potestatem inopinanti (ei) venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis inopinantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48, 14</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inopinate: <entryFree id="n23642" type="main" key="i^no^pi_na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnātō</orth>, <sense id="n23642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. inopinatus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inopinatus: <entryFree id="n23643" type="main" key="i^no^pi_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n23643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not expected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23643.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc illi improvisum atque inopinatum accidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova tibi haec sunt et inopinata?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">24: neque novum neque inopinatum mihi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec hoc tam re est, quam dictu inopinatum atque mirabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:section=35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:133" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quoque scriptum est, quod volgo inopinatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to the common belief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopinatissim us sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23643.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something unexpected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil inopinati accidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ex inopinato, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae ut ex inopinato observant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente ex inopinato prope cuncta turbata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n23643.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inopinate occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23643.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpīnātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra irrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inopinor: <entryFree id="n23644" type="main" key="i^no^pi_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpīnor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander facilius inopinatus, Val. Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 52 Mai. (but a false read. for opinor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 5</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
inopinus: <entryFree id="n23645" type="main" key="i^no^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose = in-opinatus, insperatus): <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 857</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova inopinave facies laborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inopiosus: <entryFree id="n23646" type="hapax" key="i^no^pi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inops</etym>, <sense id="n23646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in want of</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">res inopiosae consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inoppidatus: <entryFree id="n23647" type="main" key="i^noppi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-oppĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has no town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not dwelling in a town</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gabalitani sparsi, inoppidati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: inoppidatus <foreign lang="greek">a)oi/khtos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inopportunus: <entryFree id="n23648" type="main" key="i^nopportu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-opportūnus</orth>, <sense id="n23648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfitting</hi> (late Lat.), <pb n="960" /> <cb n="INOR" /> Oros. c. Pelag. p. 618 (also a false reading in two places for importunus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 18</bibl>). — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnopportūnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, Aug. c. Faust. 22, 72.</sense></entryFree>
inops: <entryFree id="n23649" type="main" key="i^nops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-opis</etym>, <sense id="n23649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without resources</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helpless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23649.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ope inops, qui ejus indiget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 92</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">inopes relicti a duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cum potentiore juris humani relinquitur inopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solare inopem et succurre relictae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 290</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23649.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic inopes et ab amicis, et ab existimatione sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23649.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopes laudis conscendere carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>unable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit> (3, 1, 23 Müll.).— </sense><sense id="n23649.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">helpless through poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23649.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res pauperes inopesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium inops et exhaustum,</quote> <trans><tr>empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te semper inops vexet cupido,</quote> <trans><tr>unsated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus cujusvis inopis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 4</bibl></cit>. —Esp., of the dead who could not pay Charon's fee: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnis inops inhumataque turba est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">infletaeque jacent inopes super arva catervae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 4</bibl></cit>: mortuis in ore nummum immittere, ut apud inferos non tamquam inopes errent, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:267" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 267</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23649.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:457" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:373" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus auxilii humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:96" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni cibique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciae virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles Martis,</quote> <trans><tr>that never fights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 334</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23649.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŏpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, opp. potentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 61, 17</bibl> Dietsch.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil cum potentiore juris humani relinquitur inopi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23649.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23649.9" n="1" level="3"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wretched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopis et pusilli animi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras inopes noluit esse vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsus atque inops amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia aegra sine armis errabant, iraeque inopes,</quote> <trans><tr>impotent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:147" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:19:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23649.10" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi> in words or ideas, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erat abundans, non inops tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inops verbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ornandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinam linguam non modo non inopem, sed locupletiorem etiam esse quam Graecam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir inopi lingua et infacundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
